text: 0,5l bottle. Hazy, thick dirty orange colour with huge but shrinking and staying in small size, foamy off-white head. Aroma: Banana, biscuit, light caramel and roasted coffee bean (!!) notes. Taste: Very rich and sweet malty start (with lots of rostieness) and seems light but then a growing sourish tone comes that turns into a lgith, softly bitter mouthfeel. Has a foamy texture but not as creamy as some other examples. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Long sourish but sweet, a little bit acidic and dry finish. Complex and good weisse.
Little hazy light amber, orange beer with small white head. Aroma is wheat and banana. Taste is sweet wheat and banana with yeasty notes. Aftertaste is with spicy notes. Descent sample of hefeweizen.
From Carrefour. In Bacaria hefe glass. Watching House of Cards 1x08-09. All typical notes of a hefeweizen perfectly placed and assembled.
Slightly hazy orange colour with white head, aroma is wheaty , banana, yeasty, taste is wheaty , bread, banana and yeast,
On tap @ Wunder Sormuvek. Decently made, conventional, german-style weizen. Nice one.

Pretty special. Lovely aroma feeds into a really banana Hefeweizen. Smooth with a slight fizz. Stunning dark amber shades in the glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. Semi-clear orange-brown with two finger white head. Aroma is fresh with light herbal notes, wheat, soft ripe banana and smooth yeastiness. Taste is sweet wheat, ripe banana, light yeastiness, light citrus, light grass and a minimal light spiciness in the finish. Medium mouthfeel, light carbonation and soft sweet-ish aftertaste.
Drucken på fat på Teahaus in der Englische Garten i Tiergarten, Berlin. Ganska söt och nästan lite kvalmig för stilen. Annars alla stiltypiska tecken på en bra hefe. Gott

Bottle 0.5
Очень хороший вайцен.

Kolor złoty wchodzący w pomarańcz, miedziane refleksy, mętny. Piana średniej struktury wysoka, ale dość szybko opada. W aromacie wyraźne estry owocowe i przyprawowe - w miarę wyrównana proporcja banana i goździka, w tle aromaty słodowe, pszeniczne i drożdżowe. W smaku pszenica, miód, banany, lekka morela, goździki delikatnie kwaskowo. Bardzo dobra konstrukcja, ani wytrawne ani pełne, takie deserowe - taki jaki moim zdaniem powinien być hefeweizen. Pijalność wysoka, orzeźwiające w upalne dni (w cieniu pod wieczór mam 31 stopni). Polecam.

Pretty special. Lovely aroma feeds into a really banana Hefeweizen. Smooth with a slight fizz. Stunning dark amber shades in the glass. Milky on the palate afterwards, almost like a banana milkshake. One of the best Ive ever had.
Piana wysoka jak na pszeniczniaka przystalo. Aromat pszeniczny z nuta banana. W smaku wszystko jak trzeba jest chleb I banan. Ladny ciemno pomaranczowy kolor. Dobra tresciwe piwo. Polecam.

0,5l bottle at Schweigers Bierbeisl/Wien 17.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dunkelorangefarben, hefetrüb mit schöner Schaumkrone. Fruchtig bananiger Antrunk, schön würzig, Nelke, Muskat. Der gutdosierte Kohlensäüuregehalt macht dieses Weizen sehr süffig.

From meny; beautiful strong reddish orange color with huge white head; aroma is intense fruity, very overripe fruits, banana, gentle spicy phenolic background; taste is very fruity with low to medium sweetness, banana, slightly citric, a tiny bit of tartness, round phenolic spicy finish with a hint of hoppy bitterness; texture is big and creamy with high carbonation and a medium body
Bottle from Brdr. Schmidt Vinhandel, Viby. Pours orange with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is malt, banana, bread, yeast, caramel notes. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Sweet fruity finish.

Trochę rozczarowanie jak na piwo w top 50 stylu. Aromat nie był jakiś szczególnie intensywny. Banan był wuczuwalny, goździk już dużo mniej - do tego jeszcze jakieś nuty estrowe. W smaku wodniste, słodowe, raczej więcej nut goździkowych niż banana, ale ogólnie to mało i jednych i drugich. Na plus niezła piana i mętność. Mogłoby być trochę bardziej nagazowane.

500 ml bottle. Pours foggy orange apricot colour. 1 finger white porous head. Stays. Okay retention. Flat carbonation. Aroma: sweet tobacco, ripe banana, toffee, spices, cellar yeast. Flavour is citric, sour apples, cider, flour. Dry, crisp & refreshing. Not the very hefeweizen Im keen on, but very decent one.
Bardo dobry weizen. W smaku banany, goździki, lekka kwaskowość. W aromacie głównie banany. Piana obfita, trwała. Wysycenie odpowiednie. Barwa jasnopomarańczowa, mętne. Bardzo zbliżone do Schneidera.
Aroma of overripe banana, esters, some apricot. Taste is more banana, caramel,yeast.Drinkable,refreshing.
Rigtig dejlig Weisse med en rigtig flot nærmest orange farve. Dejlig frugtagtig smag og et flot Hvidt skum

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 (500 ml bottle) Slightly hazy, copper-golden beer, with a fast-dissipating, foamy white head. Steady carbonation from the bottom of the glass. A predominantly malty aroma: fresh wheat, kiwi, banana, bread, caramel, and orange. A touch of clove on tongue, and some retronasal yeasty aromas.

This beer is surprisingly clear for a Hefeweizen.  It has a fairly light palate and aroma, and is just a bit too watery.  Having seen this beer had excellent reviews, I was rather disappointed.

Dark orange with nice white head.
Banana, fruity and spicy finish. A nice example of a Weisse

50cl bottle purchased @ Tante Emma Laden. Belle robe jaune paille un peu trouble avec une fine mousse . Arôme de banane très léger qui se termine par du clou de girofle. Carbo parfaite et bon fruité dans lensemble.
On tap at beer geek Prague. Pours hazy light gold. Nose of overripe banana, esters, some apricot. Taste is more banana, refreshing.
Bottle. Dark orange with a decent head. Aroma of bananas and yeast. Taste dto. Sour finish. Strong carbonation and heavy mouthfeel. Ok but not the Hefeweizen of my choice.
Wypite jakis czas temu, ocena w ramach uzupelnienia profilu. Dobra pszenica, warta sprobowania
Na początku zdecydowanie estrowe, bananowe, szybko jednak do głosu dochodzą goździkowe fenole, wysycenie średnie. Dobrze zbalansowane, mało agresywne.
Bardzo poprawny hefeweissen. Złociste mętne gęsta piana. Goździki banany. Przyjemne na języku. Taki Paulaner plus plus.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Birra dal colore ambrato opaco schiuma abbondante. Media carbonatazione. All?olfatto note fruttate, con un pizzico di noce moscata. Al palato sentori di frutta esotica. Una buona birra.

Draft. Very murky opaque orange (amazing colour). Very fruity (citrus-orange, peach, banana). Spicy (coriander, clove). Wheaty, yeasty, malty (buttery caramel). Medium bodied. Sweet, smooth, rich. Dryish fruity finish. Very drinkable. Enjoyed this. Terrific beer! (2008) Also in Bottle - Bottle good, Draft Amazing.

Bottle; pours cloudy orange amber with an off white head; aroma of bananas and yeast with some hints of wheat and spice; taste is slightly sweet with banana, yeast, and wheat with a trace of caramel; finish has some light spice
Strong sweet banana aroma. Pours a great cloudy brown with a fluffy white head. Taste of banana with a sweet and spicy finish. Amazing.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2017 Buena cerveza de trigo.
Un aroma afrutado, apariencia ámbar oscura, un sabor de cuerpo medio afrutado y un paladar correcto.
No es de las mejores cervezas de trigo existentes, pero está en la zona noble del mismo estilo.
user_location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, SPAIN

text: 500 ml. bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a cloudy, orangey amber with a soon dissipating white head. Aroma of bread, yeast, overripe bananas, maybe a hint of apricot. Crisp and lively carbonation with a pleasant acidity. Well balanced with a note of sour fruit in the finish. Impressive.

Copenhagen 17/1 2017. 50 cl bottle from Meny. Some hops lying around and a lot of advertisement telling me that this beer is "Aus Bayreuth". In addition to this they seem to be very preoccupied with the fact that this is the "Original Hefe-Weissbier". Expectations cant get much higher now. Pours hazy orange with big bubbly yellowish head. Settles as thin almost non existent layer of foam. No lacing. Aroma is fruity and quite fresh. Banana and lemonade. Fairly strong carbonation and watery palate. Flavor is medium sweet followed by tart and citric fruit. A bit too thin to live up to be "the Original"but by all means a solid Hefe Weizen.
Nice taste and aroma for this white beer. The taste it is not bitter, nor sweet. it is a well done weiss bier.

Mętne, złociste, piana obfita, sycząca, błyskawicznie opada do zera.
W aromacie drożdże, pszenica, goździk, przejrzałe banany. Ogólnie słodki.
W smaku pszenica, drożdże, goździk, lekkie cytrusy/cytryna. Banan w posmaku. Kwaskowe.
Goryczka wyczuwalna, kojarzy się z takim przejrzałym, starym bananem. Niezbyt przyjemna. Wysycenie wysokie, nie za wysokie.
#1092Tap. Hazy deep golden body, high white head. Aroma of banana, wheat. Taste is neutral, slightly sour, wheaty, touch of apricots and clove. Medium body and carbonation. Average weizen.
Draught at Němý medvěd, Mělník. Hazy, gold to orange colored. AROMA- sweet fruity, wheat, yeasty, spicy. FLAVOR- lightly sour, yeasty, apples, peaches, spicy tones. Medium bodied. Not bad.

Ciemnozłote, mętne z obfitą pianą, opada dość szybko, ale zostaje do końca. Aromat estrowy, bananowy, trochę gruszki, gumy balonowej, przyjemny i poprawny, ale brakuje intensywności i jakiejś kwaskowatej nuty. Banan nadaje trochę słodyczy, ale ciężko powiedzieć, żeby było to piwo słodkie, bardzo lekka ziołowa goryczka. Dość wysokie wysycenie, ciała jest więcej niż się spodziewałem, ogólnie orzeźwiające i bardzo pijalne.

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Hefig, Weizen, fruchtig, leicht bananig, leicht zitronig. Erscheinung: Orangebraunes, trübes Bier, weizentypischer Schaum, schöne Gardine. Geschmack: weizentypisch, fruchtig, leicht säuerlich, leicht nussig. Nachgeschmack: Etwas zu viel Kohlensäure, schwer im Magen. Gesamt: Überdurchschnittliches Weizen, aber keine Offenbarung.
경쾌하게 목을 넘어간다. 입에 댄 순간의 날렵함이 곧 목넘김으로 이어진다. 알콜향이 좀 올라오는 가운데 바나나를 선두로 맛이 섞인다.

Obfita piana, ciemnozłote, zamglone. Aromat bananowy, do tego goździk, delikatnie czuć również drożdże. W smaku słodowe, banan dodaje lekkiej słodyczy, delikatnie ziołowe. Wysycenie wysokie. Jest orzeźwiające i pijalne

Nice aroma with banana and wheaty bready notes
Kinda sweet, could be a bit more tart. but its still pretty well balanced.
Bottled. Red brown body, small white head. The aroma is citrusy with some wood notes. The taste is citrusy and wheaty.

Pours dark, coppery, unclear with thick beige top ahead. Aroma- intense, cloves, fruity, yeasty. taste was sweet, min bitter. Flavor seemed not too intense for me although pleasant, easy drinkable, watery/porridge texture.

Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours hazy orange amber with a white head. Aroma of sweet esters, banana, bubble gum, rural notes, slight stable notes and sweet mandarin. Taste of banana, bubblegum, grassy hops and rural notes. Pretty good!
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of bubblegum, sweet orange, banana, esters, citrus. Taste has bubblegum, sweet banana, sweet orange, light floral.
Приятна& классич& пшеничк& Аромат банана есть, вкус традици& с лёгкой кислино&
Draught. Hazy dark amber pour with white head. Aroma has caramel and sweet malty notes. Taste is balanced on the sweet side. Ends with some bitterness. Medium carbonation. Medium heavy body
Kran. Aromat pszenicy, banan, goździk, słodki. W smaku słodkie, słodowe, owocowe.

Lukt: Malt og honning.
Utseende: Gulbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Malt og urter.
Hvor: The Underdog, Athens.

S: wheat, grain A: dark yellow, cloudy, rocky foam T: wheat, malt P: full bodied, medium sweetness, long finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piana średnia, dość szybko opada do cienkiej firanki, barwa złota, mętna, spory osad na dnie butelki. W aromacie sporo przejrzałych bananów, czerstwego chleba, troszkę przypraw z dominującym goździkiem, czyli klasyka. W smaku lekko kwaskowo, melanoidynowo, tu również banan dominuje a przyprawy dopiero na finiszu. Goryczka bardzo niska, wysycenie średnie, drobne.

Piwo generalnie dobre, choć początkowo wydaje się rześkie i pijalne, po kilku łykach zaś zaczyna męczyć, staje się bananowo mdłe...
Bottle from Biernavigatie. Hazy colour, white foam. Light sweet banana notes, some coriander. Light sweet, light bitter.well balanced hefeweizen.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2016 Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is spicy yeast, wheat, not so much bananas. Taste is bananas, spicy yeast, wheat, some toffee and caramel. Oily mouthfeel. Solid Weizen!

Flasche (50 cl) aus einem Rewe-Markt in Berlin. - Helles Goldbraun, trüb. - Nase toastmalzig-karamellig mit kräftigen obergärigen Weizenbiernoten, Nelke, ein wenig Vollkornbrot. - Antrunk dünn weizenmalzig mit zarter fruchtiger Säure (leicht unreife Banane) und Gewürznoten (Nelke). Erfreulich wenig süß, aber auch kaum herb. Gut rezent, hefig aber dünn. Kurzer Abgang mit milder Gewürznote, von mir aus auch Muskatnuß, aber leider ohne Hopfen. Als Nachtrunk bleibt nur eine fade Gewürznote. - Rundes, angenehm würziges Weizen, aber zu dünn, zu schwach gehopft und letztlich zu dröge, um besonderes Interesse zu wecken.
Хорошее пшеничн& пиво, аромат, вкус, цвет, все на высоте! Пьется легко и приятно& (Bottle 0,5/ 5,2%)

Bottle from Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is herbed olives, banana, floral / spices. Taste is clean thick bready malts with some fruity / herbal / spiced notes. Not your airy / creamy / light hefe...more of an herbal / earthy / dense malt hefeweizen one might expect from German beers.

50 cl bottle, from supermarket. Pours hazy dark golden color with a lot of white head. Aroma is wheat, bananas, medium sweet. Taste is sourish, wheat, bananas with sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation. A good beer, persons passionate of German Hefeweizen must drink it at least once.

[backlog] 04-10-15 / bottle at home. Standard Hefe. Yeasty, some fruity banana. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 3/5

Bottle with the wife. Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have pale wheat malts, light toasted bread, orange citrus, banana, coriander, decent take on the style, actually a little better than I expected.

From tap at Antica Gelateria del Corso, Milan.
Medium head, yellow colour, hazy, fair lacing. Aroma of bananas and clove, bit of grass.
Lightly sour with sweet aftertaste. Medium body, lively.
Refreshing and quite alright.
Bottle - Oft getrunken, immer gut. Wunderbare smoothe Textur, Aromen gut abgestimmt. Banane, Nelke, Brot, alles da, alles dezent. Frisch und gut.

On tap at Hopaholic, Budapest. Nose is apple, wheat. Body is opalescent orange, head is medium, cream white, creamy, mostly diminishing, excellent lacing. Aroma is apple, wheat. Medium sweet, light fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity medium sweet sour. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Easy fruity wheat beer, simple, nice one.
Keg earl of Essex Islington. Golden slight head. Aroma banana wheat taste same some cloves nice and sweet decent
Van de tap als Maisels hefe weisse. Geeloranje kleur mooie fijne kraag. Ruikt naar banaan en kruidnagel, smaakt idem met een wat bitterzure afdronk. Mocht wat voller van smaak zijn.

Crowler purchased from Growl Movement in Salem OR
$6
Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a large thick and frothy off white head.
Very strong fruity/over ripe bananas aromas. Sweet pink apples come to mind for some reason. Nice.
Taste similar to aroma but has a nice creamy aspect.
Excellent mouth feel silky smooth.
A very good drinkable weiss bier.
Piwo lane 0,5 we Wrocławiu. Kolor brązowawy, piana szybko opada i osadza się. Aromat pszeniczno-bananowy, w smaku też lekko wędzone. Dobry, niemiecki pszeniczniak słusznie wysoko oceniany.

Cloudy amber with a nice offwhite head. Nose of spice, banana, yeast, lemon. Tastes sourish with some sweetness, well balanced. Creamy texture, high carbonation. A nice hefeweizen, but no memorable perks.
Reminds me of a good Witbier, like New Belgiums Mothership Wit. Sampled at the Tap & Growler, Eugene, OR.
Bottle at Home.Dark orange colour with large white head.Aroma of ripped bananas and wheat,nice fruity and refreshing mild spicey of clove and yeast overall really good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2016 Grainy aroma. Dark amber color. Big and very soft foam. Medium carbonation. The taste is yeast, hops, caramel with a bit sourness.
Just wonderful aftertaste. Very mild and slightly sweet.
The beer is a very drinkable and gentle.
Hazy orange color with big white head. Pleasant aroma of wheat and bananas. Taste is quite similar with some spices. High carbonation. Good hefe

Amber cloudy. Med white head. Aroma of banana, clove, bread. Similar flavors. Medium banana clove finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Original hefe weizen that Ok . no sweet no bitter .Eazy to drink .Overall I think It's very good beer for me.
Pours orange with light head. Aroma is banana, sweet fruits, yeast, candies, light floral sweetness. Taste is floury, banana, light bitterness, yeast, metallic, little watery. Yummy beer!

Drinking from a 33 cl bottle. 
In the aroma citrus, grass.
The clear golden beer has a medium white head. 
In the taste grains, malt. 
High carbonated.

Tap at Hair of the Dog, Bangkok. Poured a hazy straw colour with a thin white head. The aroma is banana, grain, mineral. The flavour is light acid citrus with a smooth floral yeast palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Intense, translucent hazy orange, good and pretty dense white head shows good retention and average lacing. Aroma is vividly yeasty with strong banana, slight lemon and clove. Taste is dominantly sweet with the slightest hint of tartness: yeast, bubblegum, strong banana, clove. Light to medium body with fine crispness, very smooth and easy but still quite creamy. Its a very good weizen in terms of mouthfeel, richness and taste intensity. But its very, very sweet, even for the style, almost cloyingly so. A bit too much for my taste.

50cl bottle in glass
A: Orange hazy, thin white head
A: banana, sweet, cloves, malt
T: medium sweet, no bitter, no sour
P: light body, thin slick texture, avg carb, smooth finish malty sweet
O: great Weiss beer

Paid 2.03 for this fine heffe smooth and delightful a decent hefe I enjoy it very much . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy orange-gold pour with a thin white head. Yeast, banana, cloves on the nose. Taste is banana bread, a little spice

Ciemnozłoty kolor. Piwo jest solidnie zmętnione. Piana biała, potężna. Bardzo długo się utrzymuje i doskonale znaczy ścianki szkła. Aromat to poezja i jednocześnie wyznacznik stylu: banan, lekki goździk, potężna drożdżowa nuta, delikatny cytrus, guma balonowa. W smaku dokładnke to samo. Czysty słodowy profil z delikatną pikantną nutą w tle. Oleista faktura, sporo ciała. Lekkość picia i kremowa gładkość ma języku. Coś pięknego! Jeden z najlepszych Hefeweizenów jakie piłem.
Draft. Orange with a huge white head. Non-offensive smell of banana, malt and bubblegum. Taste of bubblegum, earth, wheat and water. A really light and bland brew.

Pours a hazy golden orange color with a white head with not much retention. Banana, clove, yeast, wheat, bubblegum and bread aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a yeast, clove and bready finish.
Berliinissä Cafe 100 Wasserissa 5/2016. Very tasty, fruity and refreshing wheat beer. A classic apparently.

Yummm! Outstanding traditional Hefeweizen beer. Aroma and flavor have that traditional spicy clove, banana, malt, sweet-tart, thirst quenching thang. Wish it was distributed around La Crosse, Wisconsin again.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 BB 17 09 16. Poured a cloudy pale to medium amber with an enormous off-white dense foam head that retained well (diminished over about a five minute period) and laced poorly. Carbonation moderate to high and fine. Aroma of soft cloves and yeasty spice and not much else except maybe a slight hint of banana. Taste initially of cloves then this drowned by moderate strength and moderately sweet banana. Light to medium body. Soft, smooth, creamy and slightly dry with moderately sweet banana on the finish. Plain but nice.

wazig donker oranje/amber met geel/witte kraag. aroma van citrus, mout, banaan, zoet. smaken evenzo verder wat dun, matig zoet, zwakke banaan, redelijke co2, licht citrus, zoetzuur, vrij beperkt, matige body, niet buitengewoon.

Bottle at the Station Hotel, Ipswich. Poured a hazy pale orange colour with a small white head. Aroma of wheat, orange, yeast, lemon and banana. Medium sweetness, light bitterness and sourness. Medium body, thin texture, average carbonation. Thought it ok though didnt realise at the time it was in style top 50.
This is what a Hefeweizenshould taste like, Old School. Not saying newer ones are not good, but if you cant brew something ng close to this, stop tryi ng to reinvent it!

Nagy, tartós hab, szűretlen, borostyán szín. Citrusos, malátás-banános, búzás illat. Íze enyhébb, gyümölcsösebb mint a szokásos búzasöröké, de ízjegyeiben tipikus. Utóíze a kortyot viszi tovább, de a gyümölcs gyorsan lecseng, a búzasörös aroma marad még egy darabig. Nem sok test szorult belé, de nem vizes. Könnyed, frissítő, de az alkoholtartalma miatt csak óvatosan. Becsapós sör.

500ml bottle served in pint glass. Purchased at Drinks of the World.
A: Pours a hazy orange color forming a medium and very creamy and solid off white head with good retention and some lacings left in the glass.
S: Sweet and very grainy nose. Strong notes of banana easters, wheat, crystal malts, cloves, caramel and bread. Flowery hops.
T: Slightly sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of caramel and crystal malts. Notes of banana, cloves and bread. Grassy hops profile. Low hops bitterness as expected.
M: Creamy body. Medium carbonation. Smooth texture. Caramel aftertaste.
O: Great drinkability. Excellent Weissbier.

Pours hazy golden with an orange hue and a huge foamy white head. The aroma has malts, banana and other fruits, wheat, yeast and caramel. It tastes medium to heavy sweet with a light wheaty finish that gives it a bitter touch. Creamy mouthfeel, pleasant carbonation and refreshing. Better than, say, Erdinger, but not as good as a Paulaner.
On tap at the brewery. Dark golden color with two finger head. Nice aroma of banana and cloves. Taste is similar, more clovey. Light, crisp and easy to drink.
Tap@ strandbad-mitte. Pours a hazy golden colour beer. Yeasty with a lot of banana. Dry finish

0.33L bottle poured into a Weizen glass

Appearance: Off brown, deep golden orange with slight haziness. Pours with a two finger head that retains quite well. 


Aroma: Started off with a earthy yeasty dominant aroma with slight metallic smell. Swirling and subsequent whiffs reveals a pleasant but subtle banana and vanilla notes. Banana aroma is must subtler compared to other weizens.


Taste: Taste is predominated by yeast and breadiness with only very slight hints of banana fruitiness to balance it out. As such the overall taste is quite dry and has restrained esters profile. Bitterness is low to almost non existent. It finishes off with subtle banana and slight clove like spiciness. The finish slowly develops into a buttery bready and nutty flavor.


Palate: Light mouth feel with a slight watery texture. Medium and lively carbonation that isnt overpowering. 


Overall : A very well balanced weizen that does not accentuate any certain aspects. Easygoing and unpretentious and no doubt quite refreshing it has something very classic about it. Though it would be better off with more fruitiness and tartness to balance off the breadiness.

A little toasted towards the end, with very light carbonation present.  Finishes a bit sweet.  Decent stuff.

The first hefeweizen I tried is probably still my favourite as it was the drink that really got me started on this random journey into beer. At least I think it was a hefeweizen, Id have to check. Whats everyone got planned for tomorrow nights beer? (Editors note: no it wasnt a hefeweizen you dumb ass. You know nothing about beer. Why are you even on here? You dont even know what hops tastes like. Get outta here.)

pours a cloudy amber-orange with a very small white head, and no lacing.

smell is of caramel, slight orange, some malt, wheat, and banana.

taste is of wheat, malt, and a slight citrus.  ends crisp.
Bottle - Banana and sweet malts fill the room.  Clear amber with no head to speak of.  Banana, wheat and some spice with no bitterness and a nice mild finish.  Great refreshing beer.

I really want to find a delicious wheat beer. This is a nice wheat beer dont get me wrong, it has all the flavours im looking for, bubblegum, cloves coriander, but it all fades too quickly. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Decent weizen,but nothing spectacular. Aroma and taste are right on target for this style., but palate is lacking and head faded quickly.

banana, bubblegum, leaves, citrus, spruce, hay, amber, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, creamy, slick feel, lively, astringent, 
Pours a hazy golden amber with 2 fingers of white foam. Banana and spices immediate aroma. Lightly sweet with a bit of citrus, not much for bitterness. Thin, watery mouthfeel with a slickness left behind.  A slight astringency before the swallow, with a clean finish and banana aftertaste. Definitely a light, refresher.

A hazy golden beer with a tall, creamy white head.  Nose is of cloves and banana with a touch of lemon grass and toffee.  Everything is very light and crisp.  In the mouth, its fresh and carries that traditional weisse flavour of citrus, yeast and spices - along with a slight sour dough and cream note.  It finishes on a mix of yeast and cloves, with the final lingering flavour of warm banana skins.  An easygoing and easily enjoyable summertime beer.
On tap at Darby's. thick, airy white cap on a hazy burnt yellowy-orange. Banana and sweet apricot aroma with barnyard yeast. Taste is similar. Biscuity. Pretty darn tasty.

Pours a hazy amber with a tall frothy white head. Aroma is wheaty with banana and yeast. Taste is also wheaty with some fruity notes leading to a wheaty and yeasty finish. Pretty good although similar to most other german hefeweizens Ive had before.

Tap at Pizza Port OB. Cloudy brownish yellow with a one finger white head, fading to a thick film before long. Also, in a shaker pint. Lots of banana esters in the nose, some old grain. Flavor continues with fairly strong banana, but the spicy clove helps things from getting seemingly sweet. Nice balance in the flavor, didnt think itd be spicy enough from the nose. Not getting the old grain in the flavor. Scant bitterness, dry finish with a little wheat. Moderate prickly carbonation with a medium body. Actually pretty solid, have never even heard of this brewery, perhaps a newly acquired import?
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text:
#561
Wow, sieht im Glas einfach toll aus! Dunkles Bernstein und Schaum forever! Das Aroma ist dezent fruchtig. Der Geschmack ist einen trügerischen Moment wie bei anderen guten Hefe-Weissbieren auch...Doch was ist das?? Eine unangenehme malzige Bittere macht sich nach dem Antrunk breit. Sehr seltsam und nicht gerade angenehm. Nur was für Fans dieser Richtung! Ich passe.
	
Test vom 16.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 15,10,9,9,9,9 - 9,75
5.4%, hazy yellow with a thin head, another very good wheat beer, will get it again.

Surprisingly golden colour and clear with a big creamy lumpy head. A little funky on the nose at first. Savoury aromas of cloves and golden flavours of ripe banana. A mellow ale, a little sweet toward the finish, I was a little bit torn writing this as those few short lines as I like my descriptions to be a little more details, but this sums this beer up nicely. Booo.

Pours a dark, hazy golden color with a good amount of head. Aroma of wet grains, a bit sour yeast. Light bodied and refreshing to taste, with the malt and fruit(banana) coming through. Very nice beer! Fizzy in the mouth.
Hazy gold,small white head.Nose of spicy yeast and corn.Somewhat sweet spicy yeast palate.
Clowdy golden yellow with quickly dissapearing white foam head. Aroma is fresh citrus fruit. Taste is citrus with little barley taste. Aftertaste is dry, fresh citrus. (Velp 201211)
Bottle. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, wheat malt and hops.

Pours a hazy, deep straw with a frothy white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, banana. Flavours replicate the nose. Flavours are nicely balanced with a hint of citrus on the finish. Theres something really nice about this beer.

The fourth in my series of ratings from a long lost notebook that turned up this morning. 

The beer pours a sort of orange color, very hazy  with a big fluffy white head that leaves a nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is heavy on banana with some light berry and clove. The beer is very pungent, inviting, and yet very sweet smelling at the same time. 

The flavor is spicy, and really not as sweet as the aroma. A mild bitterness is a welcome flavor as is the banana and clove. 

No surprises here, just a very nice example of the style that is all together enjoyable.

Pours a bright, cloudy golden with a full white head.  Aroma has lots of bubblegum in here.  There is a good amount of wheat, banana, and spices.  It gives a very European impression.  Taste contains more yeast than anything.  However, this is balanced out well wheat, banana, and traces of lemon.  There is some tartness in here.  Short aftertaste of wheat.  This one is crisp and very easy to drink.  Good beer and very representative of this style.
Lahev (pivo-expres.cz) - Slabí pěna, dlouho se neudrí, chuť výborná po ovoci , konkrétně pomeranč , citrony a dalí , velice povedená penka !
Huge white head. Amber colour. Fruity and yeasty aroma. Pure wheat beer taste. Sweet and spicy palate. One of the best wheat beers.
Aroma and flavor is a mix of bananas and mildly sweet malts, not sure if its caramel but kind of tastes like it.

50cl bottle. Hazy orangish colour with medium white head, short lasting. Aroma is light sweet and wheat. Flavor is banana, wheat, malty and light caramel. Carbonation and body are medium. Texture is oily.
Bottle shared with McTapps. In the end it´s just another weizen. But one with a good mixture of sweet and sour flavours. Big carbo, big head, yeast dominated - still drinkable.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Nice Weizen with taste of rich yeast and hints of hops and porridge. Finely carbonated with a gentle sweetness.
2012 - 09 - 30  500ml bottle. hazy orange golden colour. medium, white head. citrus and banana in aroma. light sweet taste.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2013 50cl bottle. Hazy orange color with beautiful white head. Aroma is wheaty with fuity, banana notes. Flavor sweet fruity, banana. A good hefe. 7-4-8-4-15-38 (September 2012)

50cl bottle. Hazy orange with huge long lasting white head.  Nice fruity, banana, wheaty, refreshing aroma. Flavour  is fruity, banana. Excelent refreshing beer  7-4-7-3-15-36 (June 2013)

Banana, wheaty, vanilla and spicy aroma - not very powerful but nice. lovely orange, hazy color. Taste is medium with banana, wheat, light malt and more spicy than ordinary weisse. Well balanced. Very smooth and drinkable. Nothing in particular better than other beers, but a solid brew.

Hazy amber colour with medium white head. Aroma of wheat and banana with a flavour of wheat, banana and vanilla.

--- BeerItsNice
Hazy orange pour with a light head.  Banana aroma.  Taste is full of yeast with a little banana & malt.  Mouth burns a bit.  Taste is decent.

50 cl bottle @ Naamat, Tampere.
Pours hazy mahogany color with a medium-sized frothy head. Aroma of banana, spice notes, yeast, hay and peach. Flavour of faint banana, yeast, peach, mild goose berries and toffee. Medium carbonation, mild sour palate. Very nice.

50 cl bottle @ Kahdet Kasvot, BBE 19.11.2012
Aroma is floury and somewhat stale with ripe bananas. Flavour is floury with overripe bananas, yeast and wheat. Quite rich but something disturbs me here.
Draft at The Pine Box, Seattle. Dry, meaty hefe. Deep golden, ruby gold copper. creamy head. Dry yeast, very light sweet banana. good

Bottle @ DØE / Øllets dag, Viby. Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, bubblegum. Flavor if wheat, yeat, citrus, banana, light tartness. Medium body, soft carbonation. 010912

Pours a dark hazy golden color with a medium sized frothy white head. Aromas and flavors were kind of weak but consisted of bubblegum, citrus, banana and spices. Creamy mouthfeel with a slightly tart finish. Good, solid Hefe but not great.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours hazy organish amber with medium white head.  Thick big bubble lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and banana aroma.  Taste is spicy estery wheat, banana, vanilla, and a hint of honey.  Pretty good.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2013 Very Good. Nice Banana bread aroma. very sweet with no citrus taste thank god. Kinda like Hackert Shor Wiesse but a little less sweet and more of a defined banana taste.
Amber with nice head. Aroma yeast, hops, fruit, apricot, honey. Taste yeast, well balanced hops and malt. sweet honey. Medium body, Smooth, finish fruity.
Cloudy yellow brew with a very fine but firm wheat taste and some well hidden hints of banana.
Fresh taste with a spicy bite. Has a light sharpness. Some bitter orange citrus and a hint of bubblegum sweetness.

Top beer! This is a brilliant beer, pours a lovely dark golden yellow body with a thick white head. Aroma is very interesting, picking up pretzel-like smell! Quite a thick yeast taste and a soft spice complements the classic Weissbier elements you would expect, very enjoyable!

0,5l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Light, orange brown color with medium, creamy, off-white head. Unbelivable yeasty odor with fruits and citrus. A bit sour yeasty citrus aroma at the beginning. Later a malty, caramel flavour appears. Rich, complex aroma, many flavour in perfect combination. They dont desturb each other. Medium sour, yeasty taste. Medium body, creamy, slick texture, average carbonation. Yeasty, fruity finish. Very delicious beer, one of the best hefeweizens, Ive ever tasted. Its yeast is very special and delicious, it makes the beer that good!

Tap @ Csak a jó Sör, Budapest 24.7.2012. Poured hazy amber with a frothy dirty white head. Strong banana aroma, bubblegum and wheat. Flavor very similar, banana, wheat, light spicyness. Long fruity finish. Excellent weizen.

bottle at azwine 6/5/12.

hazy iced tea color with an ow head.

it smells of sand, rubber bands, bruised red apples, spice, florals and wheat.

the flavor is the same but crispy and full of banana notes and a nice acidity before the finish. lingering naners and sand. nice and crisp

Bottle. Hazy dark reddish yellow color with a thick white head. Nice fresh aroma of yeast and wheat. Flavors are wheat and yeast with some banana. Lively carbonation. A bit harsh on palate. Yeasty finish.
On tap. Hazy golden body with a white foam. Yeasty,spicy,fruity aroma. Taste is similar to the aroma. Spicy and yeasty with some fruityness. Nice beer.

Draught  Huge, dense yellowish head over hazed orange beer, textbook lace. Oranges, banana, clove - couldnt be more classical. Bubblegum, bit of rosewater, (too) sweet flavour. Medium bodied, wheatslickness. Bit classical... read dull...
0,5l bottle. Average Hefeweizen aroma. The taste is pretty nice. A good refreshing weisse beer.
Bottle, cloudy amber-gold with a fluffy white head, yeast and banana nose, banana, cereal and bubble-gum palate, hint of pear-drops and spice in the drying finish.
Cloudy golden with a thick white head. Aroma of hops and yeast. Fruity slightly spicy flavour.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 50cl bottle shared with kermis.
Thin white head.  Slightly hazy blond pour.  Nice brew.

Bottle shared at De Paas.  Pours clear amber with a thick white head.  Aroma of cereal, light fruit, malt and yeast.  Flavour produces some light banana also, light to medium sweet, light bitter.  Medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation.
Uma cerveja típica weisse com aroma e paladar suave, no entanto uma cerveja que acompanha muito bem qualquer prato quente.Eu recomendo essa cerveja.

A couple observations rights off the bat.  This is dark for a weisse (being a dark orange), has a lot less of the pillowy head youd expect, and it is very swampy.  Aromas are banana, mineral water (perrier).  Taste is very yeasty - dough and earthy qualities, with the banana coming back through in the finish.  Refreshing, although the level of carbonation borders on too much.

Bottled sample. Dark gold in colour with strong carbonation. Aromas are of bananas and vanilla sugar cookies. More banana going on in the mouth, along with notes of white bread dough and a hint of lemon. Light chalky finish, and a bit ligher bodied than usual for the style. Doughy, yet still quite refreshing overall. Solid.

The pour: a deep orange with an off white head, quite carbonated, champagne-like. The aroma: sweet, a strong note of banana, "grass jelly". Followed by smells of yeast, orange, a bit of spicy corriander, and a faint vanilla note. The taste: quite sweet to start and lasting with a very slight bitterness. Medium bodied with a sticky or syrupy mouth feel. The verdict: very true to style with an excellent bouquet or aromas.

Gorgeous beer. Pours a dark cloudy straw colour with creamy white head. Some grainy and sweet aromas. Very clean flavours, grains and a bit of banana up front, slightly bitter finish. Full bodied. Excellent.
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2012 Nice bready banana aroma. Attractive dark hazy orange colour with nice white head. Taste is classic flavourful sweet bready banana hefeweizen. This is a great hefeweizen.

On tap. Yeast and clove aromas. Pours pale gold, cloudy, with nice white head, persistent, some lacework. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Taste is yeasty, malty, some herbal. Good finish.
Bottle from mein-biershop.de. Hazy golden color with huge stable white head. Strong banana aroma. Taste, banana, clove, citrus. Dusty, fruity finish. Little bit thin bodied but overall OK.

Dark orange coloured here with cloudy look and a huge foamy white head with great retention as expected. Some carbonation evidence from bubbles too.

Clove coriander and banana. Its not as strong as Id have liked but acceptable for the style with some fruity spice. There is also a little bubblegum aroma at the end too.

Some banana, clove and pepper with touches of spice and coriander. I enjoyed it but much better hefeweizen out there within a similar price range.

Smooth with tonnes of carbonation and a sweet fruity tang with touches of spice. Medium body and well balanced if a little weak.

Average for a hefeweizen but it was nice and had good flavour. It could have been stronger in taste along with the smell and nothing really struck me for it as being overly exciting.
Cloudy orange/gold pour. White head. Nice orange aroma, coriander, wheat, yeast. Sweet, yeasty, orange, coriander. Nice and easy. Enjoyable.

Grande Weisse! Colore un pò più scuro delle altre. Aroma in generale fruttato, con una buon effluvio di banana e Mou. Al palato si rinnovano le stesse note sentite nel profumo con un pò di biscotto dorzo. Equilibrata e corposa. Un ottima weisse
Pours orangish yellow.  Thick off white head.  Nose of wheat, yeast, and bread.  Banana flavor compliments the wheat body.

Si presenta nel bicchiere con un colore giallo chiaro non troppo acceso. Schiuma di media persistenza. Odore forte e fruttato con leggeri sentori di agrumi. In bocca non da molto di più. Di facile beva ma nulla di particolare.

11.2 oz brown bottle. After smelling this, Im sad to say that this must be past its prime. Along with traditional banana and clove, theres noticeable skunk and rubber in the nose, along with some tart berry jam. Pours hazy orange with a medium dissipating white head. Flavor is pretty muted compared to the best Bavarian hefes. Kind of bland and a little off. Im sure this is excellent fresh, which this bottle clearly is not.

(Flasche) Es getreidig gelbe bis orangne Farbe, ist hefetrüb mit einer schneeweißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist recht hefig, etwas fruchtig, vllt in Richtung Apfel. Der Geschmack ist sehr sehr schlank, es ist eine süßliche, fast samtige Note wie frisch gebackenes Brot vorhanden.Bittere ist nicht vorhanden. Die Karbonisierung passt. Zusammengefasst; ein sehr erfrischendes Weißbier, das man eher als Ersatz für eine leichte Weisse am Strand als für eine Abendessen nehmen sollte
Tap....It pours hazy golden with a large long lasting creamy white head.....The aroma is wheat, banana and some yeast.... The flavor is very fresh, wheat, banana and some citrus......
Half at York tap. Hazy amber, banana nose, biting carbonation, sweet malt, spicy wheat, banana and hint of clove. (daisy rate)

0.5 liter pour @ Prost! on Greenwood.  Dark caramel color. Banana and herbs on the nose. Lightly malty and crisp taste. Way darker than the American interpretation of this style but considerably more flavorful. Just as light too, other than the color.

Backlog November 2010 Hong Kong
Medium body and complexity
Some citrus
Ok beer

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is dark caramel orange color with lots of foamy, beige head.  Aroma is relatively weak for what I would expect in a Weizen - fruits, bananas, wheat, and spice.  Similar taste with subtle banana and strong toasted wheat flavors.  Some good citrus hop bitterness present. Palate is medium-bodied, smoother texture, foamy carbonation, and a semi-dry finish. Decent but not an expection Weizen.
Reminds me a lot of a Schneider Weisse with its amber colour, more body than a normal wheat beer, stronger. Still a very refreshing beer for those summer days comin soon! Prost!

Normal 50cl Brown Bottle, best before 31 May 2008, drank late April 2008.

Poured into a Franziskaner Weissbier Glass and it looked a typical lovely weissbier appearance. A little darker than some, but still the normal huge white head and the cloudiness and bubbles you come to expect from this type of beer.

Vanilla and Banana aromas fill your nose, toffee comes along to add another dimension, great smells.

Clean refreshing taste, dry, crisp and with a citrus twang as well.

A cracking beer and one of the best in its style for me. I am mad I only picked up a four pack when last in Germany, Ill not make that mistake again.

Tap at Sainte Ex in DC. Hazy dirty orange pour. No head retention. No lace. Nose is non descript. Papery perhaps. Taste is sweet, watery, papery. No lace. No retention. Macro hefeweizen problems. Too much banana esters. Too much melted chocolate. Okay. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excellent patio Weiss beer or for after dinner.  Orange color, wheat aroma, and cleansing palate.

Pours a hazy apricot color with light tan head. Big banana nose, clove, malt sweetness...the whole schabang. One taste delivers what the nose promises. Light+ body and active carbonation. A very solid weizen.

Draught at Bier Zone Fest in Bucharest.
Dark golden colour, cloudy appareance.
Pale beige fine head.
Aroma has intense notes of banana, yeast and fresh wood.
Lively carbonation, creamy texture, astringent finish.
I love this beer!
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2012 Hazy amberish orange colour with 3 finger head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, banana. Flavour is wheat, banana, bit bitter/sour.

500ml bottle - $2.99 at Olde Crabapple Bottle Shoppe in Alpharetta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours out a cloudy, very dark gold body with a creamyish, off-white head that settles down at a quick rate.

Smell: Wheat bread dough marked by a soft, subtle spiciness, hints of caramelly sweetness, and a gently fruity addition of chopped bananas and orchard fruit.

Taste: Bready, doughy, moderately tangy wheat malt with a fair amount of overall sweetness and low taste of caramel. Quick dash of cider. Yes, youve got your banana esters and clove bud accents, but its not nearly as forceful as some hefes can be. Light hop character, bitterness. Small pinch of ground mace for spicy, sweetish, crispish finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Moderate carbonation. Very lightly creamy.

Overall: I thought it was quite nice, actually. One of those beers where each sip demands another and, in short time, its gone.

On two at Gourmet Haus Staudt.  Hazy orangish copper with a small whitish head.  Wheaty banana aroma with some caramel.  Nice flavor, a bit like a weizenbock (is it?) with a strong malty/wheaty note, mild sweetness, banana and clove.  Medium body, a little heavy for the style maybe.  Good stuff but didnt quite meet expectations.
Golden orange color with a fruity/ester nose. Perfect weight in the mouth with a fresh mouthfeel. Layers of fruit and brioche cascade over the palate. Long finish with some light melon and citrus.
Draught. Hazy orange with a quite short lived head. Aroma of bubble gam and banana. Flavour is light caramel, wheat with a spicey tingle in the background. Finish is light fruit

500 ml bottle @ Kahdet Kasvot, Tampere. BBE 23.09.2012.
Pours a hazy orange copper colour with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet banana and other fruits, toffee and strong wheat. Flavour of sweet malts, wheat, banana and pleasant citrus. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and a sweetish, malty and wheaty finish. Great, very tasty.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2015 Alla spina. Color arancio pallido nebuloso con una soffice e cremosa schiuma bianca. Aroma di banana e spezie delicate; gusto di frutti aciduli (in primo luogo banana con sentori di limone) e un finale un po confuso asciutto e dolciastro. Di corpo leggero ma molto rinfrescante grazie alleffervescenza ed al sapore particolare.

Slightly murky pale amber with a large head that dies down into a persistant 1 finger. Aroma is banana and bubblegum esters. Light sweetness, and a nice balanced tartness evocative of stewed apple and banana. Light bodied and lively carbonation. Finish is crisp, fresh and dry - reminiscent of tonic water.

Whole Foods, P st, DC 500ml ($5): Pours an hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is a standard clove and banana thing. Body is very much on the light side, but fortunately, it is a few steps above watery. Fortunately, as well, the beer does not go too far with the sweet notes. Has a small amount of hops as per usual. Nothing really special is going on in this beer, but everything is pulled off with finesse. A nice graceful hefewiezen.

Pours light orange/gold color with a fast dissipating white head. Smells like wheat and spice. Taste is wheaty with orange, tropical fruits, spice, and some tartness. Light body. Med carbonation. Very refreshing and easy to drink.

Hazed yellow/orange, frothy white head. Aroma of banana, clove, yeast in general, some light lemony funk. Taste is nice and yeasty/citrusy. Very crisp. Bready with some light bitterness on the finish.
I do like a wheat beer and this doesnt disappoint. Classic bananas, but it doesnt quite follow through as much as Id like (does that actually mean anything?)
Flaske: Gul orange uklar øl med et kæmpe skumhoved. Duften er klassisk hefe med megen banan og en fin karbonering gør at smagen sidder lige i skabet uden at blive for sød. Dejlig øl.

Deep yellow with a nice white layer of foam. Aromas of banana, yeast and clove. Tastes of yeast, coriander, clove and orange with a hint of banana. Medium bodied and smooth going down. Really well done and what you would expect of a german hefe.

Draft. Pour is hazy yellow with a big white head, excellent retention/lace. Aroma of banana, clove, bubblegum, fruity esters. Taste is big banana, fresh bread. Very quenching. Carbonation is soft, creamy mouthfeel, bready finish. Excellent.

Dark yellow orange murky cloudy liquid with rocky white head. Aromas dough, wheat, hazelnuts, some banana. Palate watery medium thin, taste wheat malts, little yeast and fruitiness. Medium tart medium slick carbonated texture. Aftertaste little watery. Finish vaguely dry and bitter hints with sweet fruits. Rather balanced and easy to drink, but not very complex compared to some other Weissenbiers. Next time I  will try it from the typical glass, this time had experimented with Oktoberfest glas.
very nicely done. has a standard flavor of bubblegum and banana. highly carbonated with lots of fizz.  cleansing on the palate without any deep bitterness or malty overbearing.
bottle  hazy  mid gold  with good white head   . classic weisse aroma  yeasty banana spicy cloves  . taste is bready wheaty citrus  spicy with a slightly sour finish  . a decent example of its kind

citrus, herbs, chocolate, caramel, nuts, leaves, basement aromas, banana, licorice, vanilla, orange, cloudy, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, full body, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,
alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol,

Bottle, shared with my wife with a meal of warm Asian salmon salad. Pours a very hazy deep golden with a huge pillowy merangue of a head that retains beautifully. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat. Nice wheaty and yeasty palate, soft banana and clove spice, lightly tart finish. The mouthfeel is soft, but some of the flavour is muted. This was nice, but I think if I had drank this fresher it would have really shone.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle at the Trape Door, poured a hazy orange color aromas of citrus, yeast and touch of banana.  Flavor is the same with a hint of peppery clove.  Nice sessionable beer.

Pours dark orange with a big white head.  Nose is citrus and malt sweetness.  Not much else going on there.  Flavor is sweet, with a very small amount of bitter to balance.   Palate is crisp, nice carbonation.  Leaves the mouth refreshed.
Cloudy orange color with good head.Yeasty and citrus aroma. Good taste of banana and oranges.

500ml brown bottle. Hazy pour, deep golden colour. Huge column of white foam with a rocky top that refuses to die. Nose has banana esters and bright lemony hop notes. Flavour is of big, dry wheats, light lemon background, soft clove. Dry and wheaty fade out. Ultra smooth, super solid weisse with infinate drinkability. This is the hefe Ive been looking for for a long time...

The pour is golden straw body with a thick off white head. the nose is overly underwhelming  with nice sweet malts and mild spices. The middle is sweet and grainy with a nice spice complex. Notes of clove, banana, and light coriander. The malts are seemingly nonexistent with light grassy hops. Overall, mostly underwhelming but tasty regardless

Bottle; out of my Maudite glass, shared with Cole. Pours cloudy copper/orange, 1-finger cream-coloured head, lacing is spottyy to poor. Nose is dried orange rind, coriander, green tea, baking soda. Not as spicy as some other Weisse that I have had, nor as citrusy, but not flawed in any way either. Flavours of soft citrus, wheat, yeast. Really tame and disappointing in the mouth, lacks the punch of a Schneider or Hacker. Without a noticeable flaw, but lacks any real character or punch.

500ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with 2 fingers of white head that settles to a few spots of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is very mild yeast and fruit.  Taste is hoppy bitterness with some light malty sweetness and fruit with a yeasty finish.  Medium body and adequate carbonation.  A little too yeasty for my liking, but still a decent quality wheat beer.
An amazing weisse.  Served on tap.  Yeasty flavor comes through and aftertaste is lasting.  No fake banana taste.
Great weizen. Is worth my trip to germany every 2 weeks to buy this teutonian gold.
Bottled. Cloudy orange body, big white head. Malty nose with cinnamon, banana and honey. Nice spicy tasting starts and quite dry then. Mouthfeel is dry as well... Good Weiss

Bottle from Beers of Europe
Amber, clear, bit of a frothy head that dissipated, no lacing.
Aroma - Light banana and cloves , sweet malt, some spices, more subdued than other hefeweizen, pleasant but subtle aroma
Taste - Light banana and cloves, light aromatic spices, spicy hop, sweel caramel malt, tastes weaker than 5.4%
Palate - Soft carb, thin and watery, not much of a finish at all -  leaves a hint of cereal and malt, rather dull.
Overall - Rather plain hefeweizen, subdued in aroma and flavour and almost nothing to the finish. Bit disappointed with this one.
Golden and hazy. White head. Fruity aroma and flavour. Some wheat and banana. Nice.
tap at taberna belga, braga, portugal. Golden cloudy color and medium head. Cereal/wheat aroma. Low carbonation and low/medium bitterness.

Bottle: &nbsp Amberish, moderate frothy white head, spotty lacing, light carbonation. &nbsp Seems more orange 

in color than most, and not as cloudy. &nbsp Bubblegum, minor banana, and clove on the nose. &nbsp Wheaty start, 

clove, faint banana, not too heavy. &nbsp Has a slight touch of mealiness and cereal. &nbsp Moderate body and 

mouthfeel. &nbsp Seems to finish quick, leaving only wheatiness with some lingering mealy maltiness. &nbsp Its not 

bad, just not spicy enough for my tastes.

Hint of banana too. Finish even has some lovely herbal-to-pungent hops. Good stuff.
Rerate of: 500ml bottle (Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam) - 1 month past BB. Scrapping this rating entirely, not fair to the brewer.

Slightly hazy, pale golden appearance with fluffy white head. Moderate aroma of spices with citrus. Sweet buttery malts, with moderate vanilla and fruity hints in the flavor. Very smooth mouthfeel with light to medium body and decent carbonation. Slightly salty, dry clove finish. A standard german wheat.

Bottle from Sams.  Maybe my palate was funked up by the Abbaye des Rocs Grand Cru I had before it, but I thought this was odd, distinctive for the style, and quite good. Slightly hazy deep orange pour with white head of big bubbles.  Sweet and wheaty.  Biscuit notes.  The typical banana/clove/yeast were comparatively mild.  As much apple as banana.  A bit earthy and sweet.  Slightly Belgian notes, but perhaps it was the Grand Cru lingering on my palate.

Bottle at Bedford-Bamberg Spring Fest 09. Slightly hazy orange with a large white head. Aroma is cloves and wheaty biscuit, full and rather lovely. Clove and yeast in the  taste with all sorts of spicey overtones. This was pretty good.

500 ml bottle. 5.2%. From Germany.
Deep copper brown colour with massive white head. Caramel, banana, malts and wheat in aroma. Very sweet aroma. More bitterness in flavour. Fruity (apple/banana/citrus), malty and wheaty taste with some spices. Very enjoyable Weizen.

Bottle, Rehills, Newcastle upon Tyne. Creaminess and herbiness abound in another classic German beer. Pale orange in colour, with a fine, off-white, foamy head, which retains well. Poured fairly clear, with only a trace of yeast left at the bottom of the bottle. Apple and orange apparent in the taste, but subtle and beautifully in proportion.
Get it from Italian beer store in Firenze. Dark cloudy golden colour. Big head. Nice flavours of banana, fruit and malt. nice mouthfeel and good hefeweizen.

...bottle, and drank from bottle due to circumstances.  Had a nice yeast nose, with hints of hops, very herbal.  Fruity, flavorful with nice spice notes.  Well balanced brew, with a nice mouthfeel, and fruity, creamy yeast finish.

bottle. Cloudy amber yellow, large and creamy head. Yeasty-fruity nose. Full-bodied, good malty background with nice fruity flavours. This beer doesnt have the overpowering banana flavour of some Weizenbiere but features well-balanced flavours of tropical fruit (peach mainly) combined with spices such as clove. A very fine brew with a lingering fruity-yeasty finish.
A Mes rate, draught at the White Horse.Orange brown with a thin but lasting white head. Unusual faint balsamic note with some soft fruity notes and a tangy wheat finish.
Pours cloudy amber with a nice big head. Looks good. Sweet, floral and banana aroma. Very nice, crisp, sweet and yeasty flavour. Very good.

Rich sweet aroma of banana and cloves. 
Rich and sweet, somewhat cake-like, but not cloying at all, lightly tangy but not sour. Very rich and thick. Deep orange-gold-light brown color, like a Schneider. Long, fruity, spicy after taste. Very nice.
At Gollem. Bold orange body with large head. Fruity nose of banana and citrus. Sweet and fruity taste. Some citrus and banana again. Very smooth and a nice drink.

0.5 L bottle. Aroma of fresh yeast and citrus. Some banana, though less pronounced than some other Weissen beers. Cloudy golden orange / yellow with a foamy white head.
Moderately sweet, light taste. Again citrus and banana, some dried apricot. Balanced yeast and wheat. Smooth and enjoyable Weissen

Bottle. Pours marmalade colour, with finger deep white head, which quickly reduces to almost nothing at all. Sour citrus on the nose, and similar on the palate. Fairly light mouthfeel, borderline watery in  comparison to other hefes.

Draught at the Keans Head. Nottingham. Beautiful in the glass, like a sunset glowing orange at the top and a pale gold at the bottom. It has a tall foamy head. The flavour is full with the usual banana and a hint of spice but also also apricot and lemon. Very good indeed.

Bottle. Deep orangey coloured, mid-sized fluffy off-white head, that quickly diminishes into a small. stable layer. Moderate sweetish-fruity - bananas and lemons - with shy yeasty and wheaty undertones plus a tinge of toasted malt. Moderate to solid sweet-sourish flavour, medium bodied. Citrousy and caramelly traces in the sweet and slightly tart finish. Gorgeous Weizen.........
Draft, hazy, dark golden peach colour. Malt, bananna, little cloves, but not much. Not my favouritve Hefe.

Draught at White Horse, Parsons Green, London, 22 Nov 2008. Cloudy reddish brown/yellow colour with firm off-white head. Malty, wheaty nose with notes of banana, chocolate and mashed apples. Malty, wheaty taste with banana, wheat-flour dough and apples. Mild spices. Medium body, creamy and smooth mouthfeel. In short: tasty and smooth hefeweizen with banana and apples.

bottle, bar in alcudia, spain.
aroma:sour, fruity
flavor: sawdust, fruity, wheaty, faint hops. nuts/caramel??

Draught. A hazy golden colored beer, with a nice thick foamy head. The aroma of malts and fruits, like orange and bananas. The taste is smooth. It has fruits like orange, banana and fresh citrus. it has a gentle bitter aftertaste.

Bottled(500ml). -Peach orange coloured, medium sized white head, fruity acidic nose. Yeasty, wheaty and very fruity taste with notes caramel and cloves. Very refreshing and easy going beer. Genuine German Hefeweizen.

On tap by accident at Petes Place in Krebs, OK....(I was in  the kitchen and asked what was on the blank tap, which I ended up trying and discovered it was a tap for the owner only) Has a great aroma of bannana and malt. Flavor has a semi sweet maltiness with light bannana.....Mouthfeel is soft, medium, with medium-high carbonation....overall, this was some good stuff!!!

0.5l bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado who got it in Nagykanizsa (thanks!) Poured a lovely murky orange body with a big, thick creamy white head that went away slowly. Definitely a good looking hefeweizen.  Perfumey cloves in the nose, almost gluey, with some lemon. Chalky sweet clovey taste, light notes of caramel and agrumes. Superb mouthfeel, soft yet biting, the best thing about this one. Very light bitterness, some wood. A tasty, different wheat and a worthy no. 999.
chiara buona schiuma persistente note frutate non molto speziate in bocca morbida fresca leggermente acidula abbastanza fruttata poco speziata per nulla amara buona presenza di  lieviti

(bottle) beautiful hazy orange-golden hue, stable frothy head. aroma has the typical wheat and banana notes with a hint of cloves. flavour is quite neutral with a large wheat base but very little of the qualities that come through in the aroma. light body with high carbonation. disappointingly dull.

From bottle, in Hamburg. Orangey blonde cloudy pour with effervescent head giving off a shower of yeasty and citrus aromas. VERY lemony but balanced flavor - banana esters and clovey phenolics. Good as most any weizen.

No 500
Rated:04.08.2008
Bottle brown, 500 ml
Appearance: Pours very lively orangy - yellow, essentiall body, very high effervescence visually, head is initially big to huge, slowly decreasing to medium, deep, regular in structure, frothy, snowy white, there is a decent lacing, very intensive colours.
Aroma: Very nice and intensive aroma of wheat malt, greatly pronounced, very fine aroma, clover, floral - flowery herbs, very clean aroma of banana, clean milky touch, grainy touch, notes of carrot - apple natural juice, white bread, some minerality and accidity.
Flavour: Very focused and clean, well balanced taste of a noble wheat beer, very easy recognisable notes of barley malt and pure wheat grains, clove, banana, coriander, milk, whipped cream, apple juice, gentle white bread, yeastyness, very lively carbonation on palate, well balanced, slightly, gently sweet and gently salty, flowery hoppy nose, finish duration is ling.
Palate: Body is medium, texture is mild, almost creamy, carbonation on palate is quite lively, finish feel is moderate astringent and slightly chalky.

Bottle @ Gollem 2. Cloudy amber colour, big off-white head. Aroma of yeast (poo), ripe fruits, wheat and some spices. Flavour is wheat, yeast, fruits and spices. Lots of carbonation, giving it its freshness. A bit watery, nice beer though.

Good taste, but not as full flavored as I was expecting. Slightly watery. Fruity and yeasty flavor. Very light spices. Creamy mouthfeel. Highly drinkable and refreshing. Some honey sweetness, but not too sweet.

Bottled (5,2% ABV). A cloudy medium amber beer with a huge, creamy and persistent white head. The aroma is quite powerful and malty, with notes of fruits (banana, lemon), spices (cloves) and light grassy and yeasty touches. The flavour is quite sweet and has a moderate acidity. Wheat and cloves notes. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry short finish with light bitterness. A refreshing Hefeweizen, not transcendental, but drinkable.

This was a pretty good hefeweizen.  It is very banana like in flavor and aroma and is very light and mild in all flavor respects.  It is not toward the clove end of the hefeweizen spectrum, which is the extreme I gravitate toward.  This is good for fans of mild, fruity and creamy hefeweizens.
50CL bottle, the color looks like honey. Nice head. Nice fruity taste, good beer.

Good frothy head on a misty orange pour  ,good carbonation.Aroma sweet wheat,raw sugar,honey note.Flavour as sweet as I thought it might be with the aroma,brown sugar and mild honey taste,the more I drink the better the flavour.Finish,sweetness of wheat,thirst quenching.

Draft. Honey colored, with some yeast bodies. Nice Head. Lots of clean wheat malt in the nose, lightly hazy with a notable absence of esters or spice. Fruitier to the taste, light banana, and  apricot there. Its a pleasant, straightforward weisse.

Bottled 50cl. 5.4 ABV. It pours a beautiful orange beer with a white head. The nose is of banana, oranges and lemon. accompanied by olive oil and a musty characteristic. A hint of nutmeg. The taste is mainly of cloves and banana. Acidic. Nutmeg showing up. Marzipan and caramel. Poor lacing. Deeply pleasant finish with a lot of cloves and white bread appearing.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 First rating50 cl bottle at Marcus Bräu, BerlinOn June 5, 2008Cloudy orange color, fluffy white head. A bit spicy phenolic, also banana estery, scent. Clear banana ester, sweet malty taste. Fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.6/4/7/3/12=3.2RerateDraught at U Prince Miroslava, on May 24, 2015.As Maisels Weisse 12 degree.Cloudy orange color, off-white head. Banana estery, phenolic clove taste. Clove aftertaste. Fizzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.7/3/7/3/13=3.3

Bottle (50 cl) at Marcus Bräu, Berlin. Cloudy amber, medium off-white head. Fruity aroma with banans and strawberries, along with earthy and yeasty notes. Spritzy carbonation. Initially sweet, but with a dry finish. A good Hefeweizen.
Hazy golden with tiny white head. Sweet aroma with banana and yeasty notes. Sweet fruity flavor with wheaty, banana and yeasty notes. Ends sweet.
0,5l bottle. Pours hazy light yellow with a strong white foam. Aroma is wheaty with some fruit, just like the flavor. Very tasty and refreshing. A good weissbier.
On tap, hazy golden body with a large, white and creamy, white and lasting head. Nose of wheat, banana and other kind of fruit, weak yeast too. Pleasant flavour with fruit, vanilla and grain. OK.
(Bottle at Marcus-Bräu, Berlin, on 2008-02-06) Cloudy, brown colour with some yellow. Big lasting head. Banana in nose. Taste contains malts, hops and banana. Pretty good.

Very smooth, but full body.  Sweet.  Great wheat flavor with no faux-citrus flavor.  Some fruit, but not dominant.  Some good spices, but subtle, more in the background.  Creamy texture.  Very pleasing brew.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a cloudy yellowish brown with a small white head and an aroma of banana and yeast. The flavor is watery, with a soft mouthfeel. Otherwise the flavor is like a typical hefeweizen, banana, yeast and coriander, but the taste is less powerfull. I do like this, but not as much as weihenstephaner.
Bottle. Pours a light cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is a little on the yeasty side. Tastes of wheat, bitter fruit, dry spice, some hop. Palate is mostly bitter with a clean finish.

Bottled, 500ml. Amber to gold with white head, clear. Predominance of spicy notes right from the start with clove being quite dominant, there is a fruitier background with banana to the fore and touches of butterscotch, but overall the spice tends to mask the other flavours. I found this to be a bit too strident for my liking, but overall not too bad.

The aroma is weak and watery with some wheat and cloves but not much in the way of banana. The appearance is amber with a hug head. The flavor is like the aroma and not much like a wheat beer. The palate is thin. This one fits the average beer category mainly because it does not fit the style. Reminds me of a home brew.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2008 Hazy as German mountain dew the beer pours into the glass; and at once the aroma sizzles with banana, orange, pear, pinneapple, elder, honey and spice. Amazing! The flavour is sweet and soothes ones thirst . The biggest temptation seems to be not to drink it at a draught. To fullfil the portrait of a perfect Hefewizen the palate stands out with its sparkling carbonation and creamy texture.

Bottle. Huge creamy white lasting head. Excellent lacing. Cloudy orange body. Nice appearance. Heavy malty aroma; grain and nutty. Hoppy citrus aroma. Meduim body with a oily texture and a lively carbonation. The flavor is moderate sweet, light acidic and light bitter. A good well balanced beer, fruity and fresh.
A beautiful golden orange with a nice head.  Citrus and wheat beautifully balanced.  Sublime.
Hazy pale golden pour with big foamy head. As described, flavor does have some distinct unique flavor of vanilla in the background, as well as the typical wheat flavor. Nice.

Hazy dull orange, well carbonated looking with a milky head. Appealing bubblegum, bread and banana aroma. Velvety mouthfeel, full bodied and rich. Mellow banana and yeast flavor with a citrus zing. Soft finish with a saccharine note.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours copper with huge longlasting white head. Nice bottle design. Medium carbonation. Tastes of lemon, cloves, corriander. Nice high fermentation yeast, overall a very balanced and pleasing beer. I love this one!

The armoa makes me happy. Hops, yeast, corriander, spice, and bark.  Its a perfect cloudy amber golden with a large, large, frothy, frothy antique white head and excellent glass lacing. The flavor will refresh you with light malt spice, lemon, orage peel and wheat flavors. Its a great light consistency, but with body. Very nice.

50 cL bottle, thanks to sk8viking. Pours hazy orange with a huge off-white head. Mild fruity and slight caramel malty aroma. Flavour is lightly spiced and with a solid wheat note. Not too overly on the banana and bubblegum notes. Nice fresh fruity/wheaty and mellow finish.
Bottle, nice spicy aroma, cloves citrus and slight banana, great thick lasting head. Nice distinct cereal notes, some clove and finishes nice and dry. Nice palate not too heavy but not watery either.

Quite enjoyed it. Havent had weisse for quite a while and this was quite welcome in a night of strong blondes. Might not be a classic taste for this style but that isnt something that would bother me. Yeasty (that a word?) and fruity, not too shabby at all.

Bought for xmas eve 07..Smells very old world, of banana, cloves, dust, and an old maid ... very dark in colour, of orange amber bread crust ... glides down the throat, but has a very strange aftertaste that weirds it all up.... lacing is like james stewart in a wonderful life... a pin point above average Hefe but the queer aftertaste kills the overall enjoyment of this beer, but it has its place...probably..

Bottle.  Pours a beautiful, deep, cheddar yellow with a head of white that enjoys the party so much it stays til the end.  Armoma is lemon gumball, with hints of banana.  Flavor is predominantly clove, with bits of banana and bubblegum.  Watery mouthfeel.  Nice weizen; Id drink it again.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: The bottle looks good and the beer in the glass also. Fine dark colour. The flavour is much to dry for a hefeweizen, I was disappointed. Not a good beer.

Cloudy orange with a thin white head. The aroma is wheat oranges pear, apples, lemons and a hint of floral. The taste is citrusy wheat with a light body. the finish is slightly sweet. A very good summer beer. Enjoyed it very much.
Hazy amber of color with a nice white head. An aroma of wheat, cloves, fruits and yeast. A flavor of wheat, cloves and yeast.
Nice balanced weisse from this legendary brewery. Nice head the lasts as long as the beer is in the glass. Flavor is light banana and citrus.
Orange with a big and thick looking off-whitehead. Banana and clove aroma, but in a fresh, not too banana-dominated way. Fruity and dry, and really pleasant to drink.
bottle, with lemon. Golden amber, with frothy off white head.  Some banana, some orange, nice full, sweet, yeasty taste. refreshing  classic hefeweizen--the beer of summer.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 Re-rate 3/15: Bottle shared at Ariels place. Cloudy deep golden with a big white head. Aroma of bread, banana, citrus and a spicy hint. Sweetish and slightly tart flavor with banana, citrus and bread. Medium-bodied. Nice and refreshing. 7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Bottle. Cloudy red-brown color with a beige head. Quite dark for a hefe-weizen, looks almost like a dunkelweizen. Sweetish wheaty and fruity aroma with hints of bubblegum. Great sweet, yeasty, very fruity flavor. Medium-bodied. A very good Hefeweizen. 7/4/8/3/15=3.7

Clean banana aroma with perhaps some orange. Relatively dark cloudy amber pour with a thick creamy orangish head. Tastes like it smells but creamier and with clove at midpalate. Not much of a finish. Classic hefeweizen, but with an infusion of orange flavor that works.

Its been a while but I remember this well. My wife went to visit my mother for a week, but I had to stay at home due to work commitments, to dull the pain of seperation (ha ha) I ordered a case of this from a local independant wine merchant, now sadly closed, I thoroughly enjoyed its classic spice & fruit style, quite dark with a cracking head, brilliant!I If only I could get the wife to go away again!
Bottle. Hazy gold with a big white head. Standard aromas of cloves, bananas, yeast and bubble gum. Flavour had more spice and bananas with a grainy finish. Good.

From bottle. Hazy, deep old gold with a thick creamy head. Banana, also some grass and spices The flavours start sweet, but banana and clove comes towards the finish. Soft. Nice, but does not stand out.

Bottle, Meerbar at Düsseldorf. I really cant tell most of these hefeweizens apart. This has the usual yeastiness, fruitiness and smoothness. Its good by all means. I guess I need to teach my palate on these a bit more.
