Dense lasting nearwhite head. Cloudy dark orange body. Predominant ripe banana aroma. Followed by some wheat and caramel scents. Sweetish and acidulous  light fruity taste along with mild spices and notes of yeast. Soft mouthfeel. Short finish.

Goslar, Germany, in the Italian restaurant of the central square. Excellent weiss, bodyed and cooling.......................Goslar, Alemanha, no restaurante italiano da praça central. Excelente weiss, encorpada e refrescante.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2007 Buona, rinfrescante e pure abbastanza originale per lo stile, mi ha fatto una gran bella impressione. Bevuta al Golden Lion a Brescia, la sera dopo che avevo tentato di prenderla da Paola ma non cera.

[bottle]
I dont really like the aroma of this beer.  Somehow the banana, bubblegum, clove, hops, malt, which are all present, combine to smell like that rotting leaves aroma that one experiences in the late fall/early spring.  Appears brownish-orange and cloudy with yeast, plus a lasting white cover.  Sort of boring flavour: weak clove, with a touch of banana bubblegum, plus mineral water.  Some faint corriander and celery come in late.  Moderate carbonation, a bit dry finish, light body.

On draft. Overall I was disappointed by Maisels Original. I really liked their Kristall and Dunkel - bags of flavors and a smooth finish. This seemed a bit prosaic and lackluster in comparison. Looks good in the glass, a deep translucent orange body, and fluffy white head, but there is no real depth of flavor here, and it had a slick, oily palate. The other two I had in Germany, this was poured in London, but I dont see why that should make much of a difference. It was also served very cold. All in all an ok Weisse, but not as good as their other beers Ive tried.

STBF07. Aroma has banana, hints of clove, grassyness and niceness apparently. Taste is grassy, hints of white bread, corrianced and clove, thinner than expected but also hoppier than expected. Great weisse.

Bottle. Rather cloudy orange color, nice lasting creamy white head. Nice malty bubblegum aroma, banana notes, other sweet fruits, wehat and some spices. Bubblegum flavor, rather malty, maybe some vanilla and toffee. Fruity from pear, banana, apricot and citric notes. Wheat finish with some more fruits. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 Edinburgh beer festical 2007 ... Clowdy orange ... bublegum wheat ... light fruity smooth  bubblegummy ... a very good example .
tap at bat ... hazy amber ... white head ... soft zezty banana ... soft orange nose ... zezty fruits ... juicy fruits ... long zezty orange banana .... way to fizzy but really nice 3.8
Bottle. Nice white fluffy head. Slightly darker than most weissbier. Reminds me of orange juice. Sweet bubble gum aroma and flavor. A very refreshing beer.

Bottle. Pours a nice hazy golden colour with a huge long lasting creamy white ehad. aroma of banana, wheat and some yeast. the flavour is fresh and bit sweet,  smooth with wheat, banana, citrus and yeast.
Pours a lovely off orange colour with a large proud head, a floral boquetwith hints of plums and mown grass, has a light but impressive wash with a hoppy finish, all in all an inpressive hefeweizen
Hazy orange with fine fully lasting white head. Sweet malty banana/yeasty. Some citrus but mainly banana sweetness. Fresh & very nice with a moderate medium carbonation which fits it well.

Poured a soft hazy orange with a thick creamy offwhite head. The aroma was nice, citrus/lemon, slightly sour, some grass or hay in there too. The flavor is a little tart, sour, citrus still there. As a matter of fact Id say that the aroma pretty much sets you up for the taste. The palate is nice once you stir it up in your mouth and release some carbonation. Overall a good wheat.
Solid, pale pinkish color. Malty, yeasty, citrus aroma. Flavors are faint but include banana, bread and spices. Pretty sweet and only a little tart. Too easy.

Bottled.
Really beautiful; hazu orange with large and rocky head.
Lightly fruity and spicy in both aroma and flavour. A bit lght-bodied, but all-in-all an average weiss.

Relativly transparrent (compared to other weissbeers) orange loog with a fine light orange head. Very acidic citrus like aroma, more towards the fresh flowers then the traditional fruits. Palate is way smoother then other weissbeers, which tend to be overcarbonated for my taste. Flavor is hefe weisse style sweet, but in a very fine balance with the fresh citric part of the brew. Very nice experience and definetly a hefe-weisse with its own character
Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Light hoppy heavy yeasty aroma. Light bitter flabvor. Mango notes. Average finish. Oily palate. Not a great hefe.
Bottle. Cloudy orange colour with a huge white head. Aroma and flavour of banana, citrus and yeast

I have been looking for this for years and I finally found it in Amsterdam.  I was lucky to get the last bottle on the shelf. Copper colored beer, opaque, and a tall, thick head.  Light banana and cloves in the aroma.  Sweet flavor, that includes citrus, banana, and wheat.  A thick weizen.  Very good.

Fairly middle-of-the-road in style but quite competent.  Glowing darkish orange in colour with a thin persistent head. Very attractive. Nose is medium strength but mild fruity and banana confectionary notes come through clearly. Milder again to taste - very much in the dry / sharp mould with plenty of fizz and a slightly liquered fruity note tucked away at the finish. Perhaps a touch dilutive but no doubt would work well as a summer drink. Not the greatest example of the genre.
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a medium somewhat lasting white head and a fair lacing. Sub standard german hefeweizen.

Bottle. Deep orange coloured with rock solid white head. Aroma offers grain and citric acids and a little yeasty underlying note. Slightly sweet and sour taste. Finish dominated by acids and fruits. Well made hefe.

Pours a very hazy deep deep yellow, bordering on orange. Head is fine, creamy and white with the same slightly orange teint. Nice hefe aroma, lots of banana, some roses, more orange peel and a slight touch of pepper. Creamy feel that fills your mouth nicely. Not too carbonated, just dances on the tongue. Flavour is quite bitter - much more so than your average Erdinger og Paulaner. The bitterness has a flowery note to it - roses spring to mind again though this time it is a more powerful taste than rose petals would give. Begins sweet with a good feel for wheat. Quite brilliant for the kind!

[Bottle from Little Germany] Hazy, depp sunset orange glow with a thick, fluffy head. Spicey clove aroma, wheat, orange peel and some banana notes. Full, fruity palate, dry with a touch of tartness. Spot on, quenching Weisse. 

Maisels weiissseee, Maisels weisssee, you look happy to meeeeeet meee.
Small and white, cleaaan and brriiiight.
Blesss my belllyyyy foreeeeevvveerrr.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2011 After having had several cases of this, I feel the need to re-rate this one, that was the main reason for falling in love with nice German Weissbiers. The color is unclear, dark orange, and the head is huge and creamy. The aroma is harmonic with equal parts of spicy yeast (not too much or too little), lovely banana and wheat, that never is dominating or too grain. The same goes for the sweet, soft and pleasant flavour, that makes it hard to stop drinking it. From time to time I have had the opportunity to have it from tap  and I hope thats what heaven is like  IF I ever go there ;)
2005 when I just started liking weissbier: Nice, hazy, red golden color and a very huge and stable head. The aroma has notes of wheat and fruit and the mouth feel is surprisingly oily considering the style. The flavour is quite unique, it has wheat, but also a lot of other notes like honey, clover, flower, light fruit (banana and others) and the bitterness is of course minimal. Light and yet very full-bodied with a long finish. Its one of my favourite wheats, its really nice!!!
One of my favorites. Notes of bananas and more fruits, spice and sweetness. Good refreshing aftertaste in the summerheat.

Orange colored, little white head. Cloudy appearancwe, of course. Rich banana, spices and sweetness in aroma. Thin to medium bodied, crispy palated. Flavor has strong fruits with banana and apple tones, mild spices and even some vanilla tones there. Aftertaste has apple with drying touch. Nicely soft, still crispy and drinkable palate.

Bottled. Hazy golden/brown colour, big head. Aroma is wheat, banaanish malts and hops. Complete andf full aroma for a hefeweizen. Flavour is banana, wheat, malts, slight hops and caramel. Very welldone beer in all ways. Excellent for its style.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2007 Draught at The Rake Southwark. Deep yellow with a nice white layer of foam. Aromas of banana and yeast. Tastes of yeast, coriander and orange with a hint of banana. Medium bodied and smooth going down. Have seen it there several times and had even considered trying it. Well, whatever the reason for passing on it then, Im kicking myself now.

Pours a cloudy peach color with a nice white head and lace. Aroma of spices and bananas. Flavor is the same but with wheat. Mouthfeel is a bit thick for this type of beer, but it doesn;t detract from the quality. Mild finish. Very nice.
pours a very cloudy, orange with medium, off-white head...unfortunately cant decipher the rest of my notes on this one except some scores...(ahem)

Tap. Pours with a nice full yellow color, with the required murkiness and a nice head. The aromas are of fruit (bananas and grapefruit) in addition to some grains.
Flavors of bubblegum, bananas, yeast and bread. Not overly complex but well done with a medium body.

bottle from an indy beer seller. poured a hazy orange with an off white tinted head which lasted very well. aroma of banana and bread, quite deep. not sure if i over chilled this but it took a while to open up. coats the mouth nicely, finishes long too. a fine beer

Damn, a big, bad boy weissbier available world wide, lovely!!! The label didnt hook me but the beer sure did. Poured a caramel-fudge coloured hazy gold. Quite light in carbonation, unusual for a weiss, with a sloppy, messed up head of cream donning it, holding there and lacing well as it sunk into the stein. Aroma of a bakery at dawn, wholemeal and fresh sliced white bread, a little raw malt and a closer link showing of banana esters and spicy phenols. Big toasted malts in the mouth, husky, gritty, rough, fresh. This holds some very complex, well defined malt flavours. It is also peaty, nutty and earthy as it moves back towards the tonsils and long into the swallow. Reminds me of Düsseldorfs morning beers. There is a strong presence of smoke that builds with each sip. Lingering flavours of burnt, damp wood, overripe bananas and cloves aid this. Down into the swallow it is peaty and woody, volatile and lingering - a lovely depth of flavour. Body is firm, though quaffable. Carbonation holds all in check. This is lovely stuff. It is liquid bread, made to taste fantastic. Lovely!!! (50cL, 13/03/07, The Beer Store Morley)
Bottle. Banana and mixed fruits with just a hint of Benedryl. Goes down a treat.

250ml enjoyed on tap at The Rake, Borough Market (16.09.2006). Hazy orange colour. Filmy white layer. Fresh aroma of sweet fruit. Varied flavours of coriander, bitter oranges and cloves. Medium palate. Rather dry ending. Not as sweet as many other weizen.
Tap. Creamy, with the classic hazy colour (darker than other HefeWeizen). Fruity taste and long ending. HefeWeisse beers are really great and so is Maisels.
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2006 One of the best Weisse beers around. Smooth and aroma of malts, sweet banana and fruity notes. Light and clean apperance.

Tap.
Colour golden haze
Body almost full
Flavor ends bitter
Its an ok Hefe at all.
Bottle. Hazy golden coloured with a huge white head. Aroma of malts,sweet banana with fruity notes. Flavour of banana and fruits with malty notes.

Dull apricot pour with a cap of off-white. Sort of an odd smell for a hefeweizen. Dusky dried fruit. A surprising lack of phenolics. I wrote "a sort of sweet sweaty smell", but saw StewardofGondors description of "squeezable toy ponies" and thats exactly it! Gentle honey flavor with more dried fruit. Soft carbonation. Touch of cloves. This was a little past date, but I kind of like its faded quality. Actually makes me think of barleywine a little bit. Aged hefeweizen. Maybe it will catch on.

Very fruity but not too much like some Hefes can be even a litttle bitter kick at the end. Unfortunatley the bar i had this at gave it to me in the bottle and didnt have good glasswear selection so i had it out of the bottle. Leaving alot of the rating a guess but still a good drink.

Bottle.
Hazy golden coloured with a huge white head.
Aroma of malts and bananas with fruity notes.
Flavour of bananas and fruits with malty notes.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2006 Bottled - Pours a dark hazy orange with darker amber twords the middle... Smell is cloves, banana and fresh baked bread.. Flavor is very yeasty with clove and sour notes..  just ok in my book..

Got this one at a Swiss/Italian restaurant in inland northern Queensland - unexpected. Unfortunately the old duck waitress came over and poured this beer into a frosty weizen glass. Her very "careful" pour left me with a beer resembling a kristallweizen. And then she went and snatched the bottle away before I could have a look at it!! Anyway, that probably detracted from my experience with this beer and Ive probably rated it a bit lower because of it. Overall I found it to be just above the average for hefes, with a nice depth of flavour that served my well on the unseasonally wet tropical winter day.
Very middle of the road Hefeweizen. Sweet banana aroma, but light. Nice orange color with a rocky head. Yeasty, with a long refreshing finish.

Bottle from Bavaria.  Stunning beauty.  Emblazoned cloudy orange glow with a creamy, dense and orange tinted head thats quite fluffy.  Aroma makes progress and purpose out of orange sprits, vanilla, clover, banana and squeezable toy ponies.  Lemon buttercream and banana oatmeal further enhance the lining up the nose.  Flavor gels so well.  Refreshment eases in with crisp and ever-so-slightly soured lemon rinds.  Bakery fresh angel food cake with supple hints of interwoven banana flavoring.  Succinct nectar amidst orange blossoms.  Enormous flavor extravaganza.  Cloves give an invigorating fulfillment on the tongue and around the bends.  Creamy and substantive palate adrenaline and admirably effervescent.  Perfectly balanced and a down right testament to brewing beer at its very best.  Lively and spicy cackled white pepper teams with cloves and a vanilla buttercream based lemon-banana meringue pie, albeit with a light, golden honey graham crust.  Simply the best.

Orange og ufiltreret øl.

Frugt og gær duft.

Samgen som en normal weisbeer.
Hazy amber, big white head. Fresh aroma of clove, wheat, and yeast. Lively effervescence, and very clean on the palate. Classic Bavarain hefeweizen flavor profile with a clean refreshing finish.

On tap in Bayreuth, Germany.  Golden color  with a little haze, and a very thick long-lasting white head.  Nose of fruit and malts, with some nice hops.  Very smooth on the tongue, and excellent finish.

Bottle 50cl, bought in Berlin. A thick, hazy beer, with a yellow/orange/brown colour and a good whick white head. Aroma of soft wheat and fruit, especially banana. Hoppy fruity taste, classic hefe wheat. Perhaps mine was a little too warm, but I found the bubblegum wheat finish slightly sickly. Would have it again though.
Hazy orange coloured brew. Nice aroma, a bit fruity. Refreshing taste, a bit flat and a bit carbonated.
(0.5L Bottle) A good hefeweizen. Burnt orange coloring with a large long-lasting head. Subtle fruity flavor, but lacks some flavor other hefeweizens have.

Fantastic floral hop nose.  Cloudy in the glass with a persistant head and thick lace.  Flavour is refreshing, and a bit sweet and sour - some fresh malt but slightly sour yeast creating a harmonious balance.  Finish is a little thin, but ultimately a nicely drinkeable beer with good session potential.

I dont know what the hell was wrong with this beer.  Im hoping it was expired but it wasnt like any other german hefe ive had.  It poured out light and murky brown.  head disappeared to an appearance of dirty water.  Smell was bad alcohol apple smell. flavor was much of the same with the only citrus hefeweizen flavor on the finish.  Overall, a somewhat painful beer to drink.  Damn, i was on a pretty good streak of german hefes too.
Hazy orange coloured. Yeast and banana are dominating the flavour. Finish is yeasty and wheaty. An average Weizen
Cloudy brownish orange pour with a long, long lasting head.  Fruity aroma, yeasty flavor.  I really enjoyed this.
Bottled, 50 cl. Smells of hay and flowers and a little yeast. Not very full taste, but with the proper lemony tang and a finish of wheat grain and yeast. A very good weisse.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2014 Cask handpull at Fly in the Loaf, Liverpool.  Dirty cloudy orange gold colour.  More cloves than some weiss with a touch of banana and bubblegum.  Even a touch of smoke.  Otherwise a tad watery and a tad lifeless and thin 2.8 re rate golden lion pub in Bayreuth.  Esters on aroma. A standard weisse but decent and solid.  Pleasant and drinkable.

500ml bottle: poured cloudy orange with a fluffy cream colored head. Big yeasty aroma with light spice and banana. The flavor doesnt match up with the aroma. Flavor is light banana with a bit of hairspray.Moderately bitter in the finish. Good hefe.
Bottle. Off-white long lasting head. Golden unclear body. Distinct banana aroma. Surprisingly thin wheat flavor.

Bottle from Madsberg. Pours a very hazy orangish color with a big foamy white head. Nose is lots of cloves and banana esters. Mouithfeel is very fizzy and tickles the tongue. Flavors of banana and lots more cloves fill the mouth. Finishes clean on the palate.
Bottled. Hazy orange with a dense, huge head and lacings. Citric aroma with cloves. Flavor the same. Dry, light sticky palate. (051210)

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2006 A staple of my time in Bayreuth, and still one of my favorite Weißbiere.  Light, crisp, and I dare say entertaining. [3.8]
Now to the scientific testing.  Bottled.  A dark, cloudy, copper-orange pour (compare to Weihenstephaners hazy yellow), typical huge, fluffy Weisse head with thick lacing.  Massive aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, and bubblegum.  Touch more of fruit, might be green apple.  Salivating in anticipation.  All the notes represented in the aroma are in the taste, a touch of citrus.  Tart spiciness at the back of the tongue and into the throat, it lingers.  Tickles the tongue.  Thicker than the normal Hefe.  Im a big proponent of this beer, its a lot ballsier than the rest of its style. [4.2]

Pour is a cloudy copper with a white head.  Aroma is a nice wine and vinegar smell.  Flavor is sweet and fruity.  Almost like drinking a fruit juice of some kind. More cider tasting than hefe. I got this outta bargan bin so maybe its off.
Orange hefe, tall head. Fresh flavour. Mild, medium complex aroma with notes of banana. Yeast. Wheat. Velvety palate.

(Bottle 50 cl) This really is a Hefe with its own character and personality. Almost reddish brown in colour with a tall and handsome head. Vinous, slightly vinegary tartness in the nose. Typical fresh fruitiness with a soft, wheaty touch. An interesting Hefe. 180101

Bottled.  A very cloudy browny yellow coloured beer with a big white head and patchy lacing.  The aroma is disappointingly thin with only a little banana fruit.  The taste is yeasty with a little fruit.  It is a tad sour and over thin in the body.  Diasppointing.

Bottled. 
Hazy amber colour. Big estery nose, along wih a spicy touch. Ultrasmoooth body. Wheaty, estery flavour with honey notes.
A unclear brown-dark orange beer with a small white head. The taste is fruity,  spicy and a bit sweet. (Bottle 50cl)
Fruity and spicy flavour. Huge white head that lasts. Very nice aroma. Excellent finish. One of the best Weisse I had. Not bad at all.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2009 Big offwhite lasting head. Hazy opaque orangey body. Milky ash and carrot aroma with wheaty banana notes. Dry-sweetish milky banana and carrot taste with ashy notes. Mid-bodied. Rounded mouthfeel. Dry ashy milky soy sauce aftertaste. Nice, drinkable, unusual. I like it. (0.5l bottle, from some supermarket in Kiel.)

500 ml bottle, bought in Germany. ABV is 5.4%. Hazy amber colour, large slightly off-white head. "Absolutely fabulous" aroma, orgasmic in its abundancy of fruitiness and spiciness. Notes of leather too. Flavour is bit more restrained, still very nice with all the traditional hefe characteristics, wheaty and yeasty with cloves but also some caramel and brown bread. Aftertaste is, like with most wheat beers, very moderate but nice. Can you expect a hefeweizen to be much better than this?
hazy amber beer. aroma: fruity, spicy. taste: cloves, lots of banana, yeasty, malty and a bit sweet. finishes fruity and acidic(but not dry). medium mf. tasty well balanced wheat beer.
Dark golden colour, massive white head. Malty, clove nose. Wheaty, refreshing, fruity, spicy flavour with some notes of yeast in finish.
Bottle.  NIce amber body decent head.  Scents of orange and banana.  Taste is sweet with malt but what is this after taste.  Bitter acidic, kiling the refreshment.
poured a nice amber color with an orange hue.Wheat and banana bread on the nose.Bananas and bubblegum for flavors.Real interesting.The finish was quite clean and refreshing.

500ml bottle at 5.4% from beersofeurope.co.uk. I thought this was a rather unusual hefe.  For a start, its rather darker than the norm - a rather murky amber colour. The head dispersed very quickly. There are some banana esters in the aroma, but its quite restrained. I didnt pick up much in the way of spices.  The flavour is more citric than usual with an underlying sharp acidity, although it finishes up quite sweet.  Quite yeasty and theres also an unexpected touch of malt there too. Light mouthfeel. A pleasant, refreshing, but hardly exuberant wheat beer.
Usual banana-ester aroma, slightly salty flavour with clean wheat-malt character. Lovely full, soft mouthfeel.

Dark orange, almost amber colored body. The aroma is over ripe bananas and some watermelon. The slightest hint of clove. The taste is light with watermelon and just a little bit of bread crust. There is also some hint of clove in the finish. The body is creamy and smooth with active carbonation. A nice hefe.

A muscular, flavoursome German hefeweizen. Looked great: hazy orange with a short pillowy head that showed good length and laced well. And it had that classic banana-bubblegum-sandwich hefeweizen aroma. There are also buttery diacetyl notes, cloves and Id swear a whiff of kelp. One of those aromas that kept me coming back for more. Probably sat sniffing it for 10 minutes before I finally took a sip. The mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, with a hint of spritz in the finish. Medium-bodied - I like a hefeweizen with a bit of bulk. Lots of sweet bready malts up-front, some bananas and cream, a hint of allspice and a dry finish. This is the dogs bollocks.

(bottle) Dark and hazy orange colour with a big foamy slightly off-white head. Malty and fruity (banana) aroma. Soft sweetbitter flavour, medium bodied, crisp and smooth mouthfeel. Sweetmalty and fruity (banana & peach) taste with lots of bubblegum and a slightly sweetbitter and clovy but also quite thin finish.
Bottle. 5.4% Cloudy caramel colour, creamy, semi-stable head. Quite malty flavour, some butterscotch. Citric aftertaste.

Bottled, alc. 5.4 % (BB 01/2006)
Amber hazy color with brownish creamy head. Dryish, banana nose. Sweetish banana flavors with ashy (smokey) notes. Smokey aftertaste. Well-balanced, interesting weizen.

Pours turbid dark straw with big, creamy, white head.  ig aroma of hopcit, banana, clove, bubblegum.  Delectable aroma.  Tastes sour hopcity, with a finishing bananer, clove, and cinnamon palate.  The finish is fairly dense, complex, and rich.  This one surprised me in a good way.
Wheat, yeast and light citrus aroma. Hazy dark orange to amber color, frothy white head. Sweet and fruity (peach?) flavor, sparkling, clove notes. Sourly astringent finish. Quite nice one.
Nice orange gold with good head.  Nice crisp and slightly lemony aroma.  Slightly sour and citrusy flavo.  Yeast and malts in good balance.  Very respectable beer.
Bottle. Hazy orange-amber with a huge white head. Wheat and yeast aroma with some spice. Clean tasting wheat flavor. Medium bodied.

Cloudy light brown color,small but decent slightly off white head that had a good hang time then faded slowly to leave a bit of a lace behind.Nice malty some what citrusy aroma with maybe a bit of bannana in it.The flavor was much better,very good bannana flavor up front with a good carbonation that makes the flavor dance on the pallate along with a nice sweetness and a faint bit of hops towards the end.Nicely done brew,albeit not the greatest but done well enough to keep a few more around for the summer.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a big white head. Sweet fruity banana aroma and a sparkeling sweet light banana taste. Medium body and a sweet sparkeling finish. Fresh.

Bottle, at home.
Dark orange with large off-white head, nice lacings. Aroma sweet and fruity from malt and yeast. Flavor sweet and acidic. Body light to medium, watery texture, soft carbonation.

Pours a dark hazy orange colour. big white head. The aroma is malty with hints of bananas aswell. Has a smooth taste of cloves and bananas. Nice wheaty aftertaste with some hints of bitterness. A nice beer but not my best weiss bier.

I must of had a bad bottle it was nearly undrinkable and did not taste anything like a weiss. It tasted like a horrible belgian strong (albiet thats a style I tend to like overall).Sorry this was a drain pour
Adherent foam and much persistent one. Color orange much elegant one and with fine beads. Excellent aspect much elegant one. Delicate aroma with talk of lemon and wine cellar. One excellent Weisse.
An outstanding German Hefe Weisse that leaves nothing but pleasure from aroma to palate. Have yet to find a better weisse!
Orange colour with nice foam. Taste is exceptional. I´ve been in germany many times and this is the best wiessen ever tastet here.

Cloudy orange appearance, medium body, soft mouthfeel/carbonation and a sweet crisp finish. Cloves and bananas were in attendance. Im a sucker for a hefe and this was pretty good without being really special.
Cloudy copper hue with a small white head.  Sweet orangey wheaty nose pleasant yeasty, wheaty flavour with hints of orange.  A decent if a tad thin wheat beer not nastilysweet like some weisse beers.

Head is initially large, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing. Body is hazy light amber, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (bread, caramel, toasted grain, nuts), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with a note of clove, light note of banana. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. A nice example of an ur-weisse, a copper-colored old-style weisse.  Caramelly, nutty, bready malt gives a nice backbone on which the phenolic yeast can ride.  This is probably an old sample, based on the behavior of the head and relative restraint in the nose, but this is still very tasty.  Had this once before (but never got around to entering the rating), and the score is about the same. Solid.

Bottle - Aroma of banana, apricot and mango (give Wacher from Denmark credit for that pick-up - would have taken me hours to figure that out). Orange tan color - cloudy - very pretty.  Flavor more middle of the road - carbonation hits first, then light grain and a general sweetness at the end - unfortunately the unique fruit aromas dont come out much in the taste (I can taste bananas in my mouth after swallowing).  This beer is much better in Germany than in the states (would have given it a lower rating in the states).
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2005 Pleasant fruity aroma (mango?). Beautiful orange colour. Large lasting head. Very pleasant and drinkable beer.
One of the better Hefes that I have had. Nice dark orange. Off white head with great retention. Great banana nose. Good yeastiness. Very slight lactic notes in the back.
Kind of a cloudy copper color with a great looking head and an interesting aroma.  Its got just the right amount of carbonation with a crisp flavor to make it an ideal warm weather beer.
Beautiful cloudy golden orange with just the right head. Aroma is just perfect. Its got yeast, bananas and slightly spiced. Perfect mouthfell. One of the greatest!

Cloudy golden color. The spicy flavor and lively carbonation combine for a great zesty brew. Easy to drink and delicious. I can see myself drinking a bunch of this, especially since my local Kroger carries six packs of it.

Cloves on the nose as soon as you open the bottle. Pours out a murky copper/orange body with a good sized frothy white head. More cloves in the taste as well as a bit of spice and zest and maybe some banana.
A good weisse.
This is one of the best tasting , best looking beers in the world.Thank you Maisels!

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Cloudy orange coloured. Good head that lasted throughout the beer, some light lacing. Aroma of yeast and bananas. Sweet banana taste with some bubblegum. Medium mouthfeel with a long bitter/sour finish. I shall have this again.

This is darker than most Hefeweizens that Ive had. Its a deep amber; halfway to a Dunkel maybe. Light malt in the aroma and a decent bannana-clove note over the malt. Ceamy with just the right wheat bite in the finish. I imagine this is excellent when consumed fresh in Germany.
Cloudy orange coloured. Massive aroma of yeast and bananas. Cloyingly sweet banana and yeast flavour.
This is one of the better Hefeweizens Ive had.  Has a full, complex flavor and a great feel to it.  Will look for this stuff again.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: A pretty good fruity banana aroma.  Nice label, nice hazy honey colored beer with white head.  Light, tart, some faint diacetyls, yeasty.  The finish is at times fruity, at times vacuous, but always with decent zip.

Murky, dark orange appearance, fluffy white head with thin lacing. Fruity, lemony aroma, with some bubblegum notes. First sip reminded me of the grapes you find in fruit cocktail. Bublegum notes find their way through as well. A bit yeasty as well. Good thick mouthfeel with just the right amount of mouthfeel. Above average Hefe.
On tap. Took about 10 minutes to pour right. A cloudy orange/golden color with a huge white head. Very good flavor with or without the lemon they dropped in it.
A beatuful dark-golden head, with the large classic hefeweizen head. A very good taste with lots of wheat and fruits, but it failes to fill the intire mouth.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2004 (Bottle)  Pours a cloudy orange color with a medium-sized white head.  Aroma of banana, yeast, and a hint of citrus.  Good flavored Hefeweizen.
Clean copper color. Strong spicy aroma, fruity (banana), a bit metallic. Some sweetness, spiciness, but again the metallic touch.

pours dark orange and cloudy with a thick white head.  aroma smells of yeast and some lemons.  taste is smooth, definately a good hefeweiss.  not the best ive had, but certianly no where near the worst.

After I saw a friend so excited about this beer I thought he was gonna shot his load, I had to try it to see what the fuss was about. Its not easy to find down this part of the world but I wasnt disappointed. A fantastic aroma, great head and a surprisingly dark colour. It may look like a muddy draught but my God it is something special once it tickles your taste buds. Drinking it out of my Maisels glass just topped off a great drinking experience. THATS IT I'M MOVING TO GERMANY :-)

Ok, so here we got a Maisels Weisse, heard a lot of good thing about this stuff. The appearance is simply beautiful. Just as a weizen should look, hazy orange to golden color with a huge head and lots of tiny bubbles. The aroma is banana, some clove, yeast and some hints of smoke, very nice balanced. Althoug the nice aroma i find it a bit too neutral in flavor, it lacks just a bit more of everything. Has a nice fruityness. A very decent hefeweizen... Got a case to chug through...
This is the best Weisse beer I have tasted.  The flavor for a Hefe Weisse is not overpowering.  A nice flavor, color, and smooth.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2006 Very good weissbier, in fact one of the best I ever had! Colour is darker than most weissbiers, almost orange. Aroma is malt and fruit, and taste is sweet without beeing too sweet.

Aroma seemed lacking in the required bubblegum etc, but certainly pleasent enough.  Appearance was top notch, with a nice big white head, cloudy brew which was nicely carbonated.  Fruity in flavour, far more so than what I would expect for the style.  Not a bad beer, but seems unworthy of some of the praise delivered here.

Wow!  Impressive, well balanced beer. The light amber pour proved to have a nice frothy head and was more clear than I expected for a wheat with such a clean finish.  Reading a previous review about a "Cola-Weizen" would seem implausable, but this is soooooo smoooth, it could blend with anything and not dominate.

I thought this was absolutely fabulous.   Definitely one of the best wheat beers I have ever had.  A dark golden appearance, with a light fizzy head.  Appearance is very cloudy.  The aroma is spicy, with cinnamon and nutmeg being the predominant flavors.  The flavor is very tangy and tart, fruity with lots of banana and clove and bubblegum.

This was my very first weizen. I purchased a bottle of this at a specialty grocery in Durham NC in 1990. I always pick up a bottle whenever I find it. Very nice balance with a crisp finish and strong wheat character.

I generally divide the Heffe's into 2 categories for starters,banana or bubble gum. This is fruity banana, great head and appearance and a very pleasing finish! Right up ther with Weihenstephen as my favorite Heffe's

Hazy, deep golden lager with a small, creamy, off-white head.
Fruity, spicy aroma.
Bland, but well-balanced, citrusy flavor with notes of straw and grass. Medium-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, crisp, clean finish.
Not a world beater, but a quality brew and much, much better than the A-B World Select that I just poured down the drain.
In Germany they mix this with Coke to make a "Cola-Weizen" The local girls love it and there's no shortage of American Soldiers to buy it for them.

50 cL bottle, wheat glass.  Toasted light bread, wheat malt (M); strong banana/clove aroma (more banana than clove).  Huge, frothy, creamy, white head is well lasting and sits on a very hazy and carbonated amber body.  Medium-heavily sweet, moderately acidic flavor turns into a moderately sweet, lightly acidic finish.  Medium-full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation.  The bottom line is: what a rockin' wheat!

a hazy orange shade, with an amber creamy head that lasts well.  A very well balanced wheat and fruit smell, with an obvious yeasty overtone.  Creamy mouthfeel, and a clean taste.  This could become a favorite.  Very refreshing and well brewed beer.
An unclear brown-orange beer with a fine head. The aroma is of wheat with notes of oranges. The flavor is of wheat, citrus, oranges. A little light - but a good german wheatbeer.
Looks like Schneider Weisse.  Big fluffy head, with great retention.  All banana nose.  Apple, fruit, banana, citrus, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, big clove finish.  Delicate yet firm...yummy.

Brown colour. Yeasty, banana taste; what you would expect from a Weizen, but somehow the taste is not very interesting. That does not mean that it´s not a well-balanced, drinkable Weisse. But somehow there´s is something missing.

Yeasty citric aroma, not as strong nose as in other Weisse though. 
Murky red-brown, creamy head.
Banana and vanilla on a bready background. No real dominant traits, which makes it pleasant to drink, but a bit uninterresting in the long run.
Medium to light body and a slight honey aftertaste.
Stale bottle. Hints of what hefeweizen can do, hidden behind a cardboard screen. Note to self: Must find a bottle shop with really good turnover, or sell a kidney and start buying cases.

Awesome stuff. Not sure it's quite better than Schneider but it's well cool. The yeast is all over as is sugar bananas and that breakfast vibe. Not sure about citrus anywhere, more bready I thought. Stop eating those stale oranges. This is heaps better than the Kristall, by the way...
Lovely citrus aroma wioth spices. Cloudy, orange coloured, good head. Sweet, spicy and citrus smell, well balanced. Refreshing and clean palate. Decent brew.
A beer that definitely is better when it is warmed up.  Loads of citrus flavoring that has a slight aftertaste.

Not usually a big fan of wheat beers, but this is a damn fine brew!  Cloudy orange color with big white head.  Reminds me of Alaskan Summer Ale - a fruity, almost banana-like palate.  Great citrus notes as well.  Would recommend this one to anyone who enjoys a good summer-type beer.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2003 Bottled. I found this in a convenience store at the Doral Building on Michigan Avenue, tucked behind the Coors Light tallboys. Tasted it on the train home, since the rush hour schedule wouldn't let me stop over at Flossmoor Station.
Drank this from the bottle, so I couldn't tell the color well. But drinking from the bottle did kick up a nice foamy head inside, and there was a fine coating of yeast at the bottom of the bottle. Presented a nice wheaty nose when I opened the bottle. The usual clove and banana tastes only became apparent after the first few sips. Between that was a nice malty sweetness balanced unobtrusively by German hops. Further down the bottle, the lemony taste becomes evident, which builds to a nice tartness as it warms up. All in all, a good, tasty beer to find.

Uhm. The last one I had was better than I remembered, so I think it's time for me to rate it.
Deep amber color, almost orange, darker than most hefe-weizen (btw, it's a bit stronger in alcohol, also). Beautiful, though not huge, white head. Full aroma of banana, lemon and spices. Fresh and crisp, but with a good malt and yeast consistence. Clean and slightly acidic finish.

One of my favorites! Deep amber body that clouds when the yeast is added. Fluffly white head and full nose. Banana, clove, spices, and some sweetness. Chewy dough-like malted and yeasty body. Add some spice and fruit hint to this as well. Not as spicy as some other wheats. Nice smooth finish. Refreshingly uncomplex. Great beer!

Thick white head dark caramel color, cloudy. Sweet sugary aroma, missing the lightness I was looking for. Malty, citrus, the range of flavours was not fully developed in this sample. I bit disappointing.
Dark yellow with a nice white head. Has a fruity taste with a nice spicy finish. A bit heavy for a weissbier.

Murky dark yellow hue with a medium off-white head. Good body for a German Wheat. Moderate malty and yeasty aroma with hints of banana, dough, grain, coriander, and lemon. very nice spicy and fruity tones on the palate, slighty bready finish. Creamy and soft mouthfeel. Heavy for a weizen but in this case, it's a good thing. Recommended.

Dark orange brown color, frothy head. Citric aroma in which orange dominates. Orange flavor, yeasty with hintsd of banana. Rather thin. Decent weizenbier, not too much aroma and flavor, but a good thirst quencher.

Tastes like a disgusting Belgian beer, which tastes like bananas.  It reminds me of that sickening yellow gum that used to come in The Monkees music group trading cards in the 1960's.  I won't buy another weisse or Belgian beer ever again.  I'd rather have a Budweiser than a banana flavored beer.

(0,5 ltr Bottle) Pours a medium, foamy, almond hed and a cloudy, orange-amber body. Aroma of mild malt and bananas. Much like Paulaner but less full-bodied, thin, acidic and fizzy. Nice but many other better Germain Weisse...

Beautiful, large, long-lasting off-white head. Cloudy amber. Sweet (banana) and slightly grassy aroma. Silky texture. Lacks taste!?! A little sweet, little acidic, little bitter... My eyes and nose loved it but my mouth was disappointed.

Pours a dark orange that borders on red and brown.  The head has is tight and persistent with tiny bubbles.  The aroma is full of banana, lemon zest, bubble gum and yeast.  The flavor here is closer to the nose than I remember with most of this style.  Nice fruit flavors without being too sweet, grainy malt and yeasty bread.  Very pleasant and quite satisfying.

Citrusy, banana, and bubblegum. Sweet and estery with some brown sugar. Cloudy brown-orange, rich in color. Off-white foamy lacing head. Medium-high but smooth carb and medium watery body with a little chew. Good flavor - starts a little sweet with some lemon zest and bananas. Wheaty and a bit chewy from yeast sediments. Slight malty/tart finish and refreshing sweet/bitter after. Well-balanced. Good quality wheat beer.
Fine fruit, apple, banana is the overall impression of this beer. Pure and clean in aroma and flavor.

My first weiss of the season!  And it looks like a beauty, slightly cloudy deep golden with a massive, massive billowy off-white head.  Nice banana-citrus aroma, maybe a hint of Cointreau?  Flavor lemony, lightly acidic; body is very smooth, crisp, full.  Seems a little "tame" to me, but still excellent; wonder how Paulaner will fare next to it in this taste-test?

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2003 A lovely medium dark colour, with a big, white head, and an inviting aroma.  A smooth taste, which bursts with flavours as it moves to the back of the palate, leaving slight watery tinges in the aftertaste. A great German wheat beer, which ranks up there with the best.
Has a cloudy amber/yellow color with some carbonation and a fruity/spice smell.  Taste is also fruity/spice with malt and finishes with a nice wheat flavor.  Overall a great wheat beer.

Pale golden colour, the usual cloudy appereance, impressive frothy head, really lasting. The usual malt-banana-clove aroma. The flavour is delicate, quite sweet and fruity (banana, apple and citrus). Slightly spicy finish. Nice German wheat!
Hazy, doughy color with a full, thick, creamy white head.  Nice banana/yeast aroma and full, fresh flavor.  A slight lemony flavor that was not too sour.  An excellent beer for the price.
Hazy honey color with a large white head.  Wheat aroma, slight banana, spices.  Very smooth, not much flavor.

Lovely fruity (bananas, oranges) and yeasty aroma. Very refreshing flavour with fruits and cloves. The balance between the "freshness" and sweetness is good. Probably a bit less sweet than Erdinger and Franziskaner. A great summer beer!

More hoppy in the nose with some spruce, lemon, and slight mold and sulfur smells.  Hazy orange color with minimum head.  Fairly interesting with some lemon sting and yeast chewing - a little thin in the body with a dry texture.  Finishes acidic with a soft feeling.
A nice cheap wheat that has great banana/yeast/spice nose and taste. Can't beat it for $2 per bottle.

I've had better samples.  THis one was spritzy annd quite lacking in flavor--I'm sure it was old.  Closed with a sour note--not very good.  Usually, one of the better weizens.  A bit darker than most, with tons of esters in nose and mouth.  On this one, the nose was simply yeasty.  Must try again.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2003 If there's one beer I've been searching for over the past year, this is it!  What a quest.  Like King Arthur searching for the holy grail, I trekked in vain to store after store, and then one day - there it was.  Remembering it to be the best German Wheat I'd ever had, I took it home to a 3-way tasteoff with current champs Hacker-Pschorr Weisse and Weihenstephaner Weisse only to have Maisels come up just a tad short.  It was magnificently wheaty, yes, and complex and full of yeasty cloudiness, but it was more bitter than the others and had a crispness I didn't care for.  It's so murky, it looks like a glass of tea.

THIS is absolutely the real deal....darker in color than expected, perfect appearance (chill haze, huge white head). And banana heaven here...slightly dimished clove compared to the big banana and some other fruit...almost pearish. Why oh Why oh Why did I only buy one?! Addendum: The yeast pour can be substantial and really thickens and mellows the beer wonderfully.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Dark brown in colour, grapey in smell. Acidic in taste, slightly grapey though...an all-around good beer!
Colour of tea with a beautiful head.. Interesting aroma of butter and banana. The flavour is well-balanced with a touch of acidity. The finish is long and fruity (banana). A good, fruity weizen.

pours a dull fairly clear orange with a thin white mostly non-lasting head. aroma is an excellent mixture of spices (most notably nutmeg) and malts and bubblegum. flavor is also quite nice with bubblegum qualities, but finish has a metallic quality to it and an almost unpleasant bitterness. still, a very good wheat.

copper-orange brown colour, various fruits with a hint of ginger, sublime wheat in the background.
this wheat neats delicate balancaing of temperature, it does not like too much cold. if  one find the matching temperature, its a real experience.
Among the german light colour wheats, this is surely unique. IMHO the No. 1 among the german light wheats.
- Its silly to spice up non-filtered (non chrystal) wheat beers with lemon, and especially silly in this case.
Great German Wheat, was really refreshing after a week of wine, pils, and Kolsch.  Great color.

Pours a cloudy orange color with a big, long lasting off-white head. Good estery, yeasty wheat beer aroma. Nice carbonation level, medium body, malty flavors dominate with some banana in the finish. Very good and refreshing, another tasty German wheat.
A fairly good wheat beer.  Not my favorite but I seem to run across it a lot in the states and thus drink it fairly often.

I actually remember having this 4 years ago on the Deutsche Bahn from Munich to Berlin, but of course this site wasnt around then, and nor did I have the beer knowledge to rate it either.  Slightly peppery banana and clove aroma coming from the cloudy amber body.  The head is a soft dense white.  Wonderful Hefe/yeast aroma.  The body is fuller than most German wheats and has caramel malty tones and a well rounded Hallertauer hop finish.  It tastes just as I remember it, more or less...
I have nothing really new to add.  Bready nose, sweetness present up front, and doughy palate/bready aftertaste.  Very little bitterness.  Good stuff....
Its strength lies in the yeast. It underscores its fresh and slightly sweet taste. Very nice appearance.

Honey colored with a lush frothy head.  Pear, cider,with a touch of cinnimon and mace.  Doughy wheat and yeast charactor that is given a little life by a pear charactor.  Could uses a little lemon though.

Opaque, pumpkin orangey color, great ghead formation and carbonation. Pear, banana and spice in the aroma. Medium bodied palate makes this a guzzling beer. Pear sweetness at front, turning drier towards the end. Mild banana fruitiness and slight bitterness.

simply put, yummmmm!
This beer has personality and the character to back it up.

This was quite nice.  Deeper colored than most weisses (weissi?  weissae?), like cloudy iced tea.  Very fresh and clean nose, distant hints of fruitiness.  Lovely flavor, soft banana, ripe fruit, and zippy candy sugars.  Slightly tart.  Very pleasing texture, fuller, richer, and softer than most brews of this style.  Dry finish, very crisp, and refreshing as all get out.  One of the better hefes Ive run into.  Yum.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2003 Hazy orange red colour. You can find the usual banana, vanilla and cloves notes. The flavour is dry and not as distinct as in other wheats, but still its very good. Very crisp and dry aftertaste with a touch of bitterness.

Lightly murky body, honey colored, with a number of large yeast bodies.  Average head.  Lots of clean wheat malt in the nose, lightly herbal/grassy, with a notable absence of esters or spice.  Interesting.  Fruitier to the taste, light banana, and theres definitely apricot there, which I enjoyed.  Rather understated for the style, and the texture is a bit thin.  I wasnt bowled over by this one by any means, but its a pleasant, straightforward weisse.
Banana and cloves in the nose but this beer is more subtle than most German wheats.  It finishes just a bit dry and that makes this one very drinkable beer.

Opaque russet. Thick, sticky light tan foam. Streaming carbonation. Abundant Weizen notes in the aroma. Apple, lemon, clove, vanilla with hints of tartness. Initially a bit spritzy but with a solid body beneath. Gentle apple tartness. Medium body. Not very thick or creamy, but adequate. Mild clove, vanilla and banana faceoff. As it warms the cloves win out. Tartness remains. Finishes less bubbly with a maraschino cherry essence that comes out of nowhere. Solid, but hardly world class.

Wheaty nose with floral hints, deep amber colour with almost perfect pillow of white, creamy froth. Strong peachy-apricot, banana flavours blend in a cloying maltiness. Clean sweet finish. Brillyant mate, get it up ya...
Great appreance but the flavour and aroma lacks the bitterness of some wheat beers. Generally its flavour is very sweet.
After a week of drinking wine on the Rhine this one tasted good.  Not as good as the fresh Farny in Lindau, or Allgauer in Kempten but still pretty good.

Very middle of the road Hefeweizen. A bit darker than normal. Light, fruity aroma. Runs toward a nutty or grainy flavor. Only slight clove flavor. A bit more effervescence than necessary. Leaves a tangy aftertaste.
Excellent hefe, although not quite as good as Weihenstephaner.
Yellow/orange color. Watery white.
Yellow color. Bit sour wheat.

Light yeasty nose. Brownish-orange color and fat tan head. Taste is laced with cloves and spices. Full mouth feel and the flavor stays in you cheeks for a while. Good Hefeweizen- - I really like this. Has a little more hutzpah than others.
Sweet banana aroma, but light. Nice orange color with a rocky head. Yeasty, with a long refreshing finish. Very nice wheat!
not overly aggersive vey mild i can drink this  shit all day
Tasty beer, banana and spicy yeasty flavours, an excellent german wheat, tasty.
copper gold color.  big head - gone quickly.  tangy/fruity/yeasty taste - bright tasting.  medium body; thicker than expected.

Large head on pour, but dissipates quickly.  Nice muddy copper color.  Aroma reminds me of apple baby food -- sweet and appley, but not quite like cider or applesauce.  Has a sweet chewiness with a mildly bitter finish and a bit of hard cider in there.  Has a very balanced fullness.  Interesting.

Cloudy copper body (Im surprised theres no dunkel in the name), big head that almost completely dissipated.  Sweet aroma of peach and yeast, along with trace of alcohol.  Flavor is surprisingly complex, with peach, caramel and yeast the most prominent.  Bananas in there as well.  Sourness asserts itself slightly on the swallow.  This has a relatively clean palate that holds the flavor well.  I really enjoyed this beer.
Darker than many Weissebiers, orange amber with moderate rocky head and plenty of condition. Not as good as weihenstephan but way better than Erdinger.

Hazy yellow-orange-brown colour with medium-large chunky looking medium lasting creamy head. Aromas include cidery sour, malty and hops. Smooth weisse beer balanced  palate, some sour but not too much. Clean refreshing slightly sour, weet-bix finish and aftertaste. Definitely the best weisse beer Ive had yet.

pale amber colour with head, fine fruity aroma (banana and peach), sweet and quite neutral flavour - a little bit heavy
This beer has a nice foam with a pale brown colour. Its aroma is quite discreet with notes of yeast. The flavour is a little bit flat with a quite short finish
Another great example of an ur-weiss.  Slightly darker in color with great phenols of clove and banana.
I tried thsi recently...cant remember exactly what it tasted like, but it was nice!
Definitely one of the best beers in the world. Dark amber colored, solid white foam and a great taste and aroma.
i must say this has to be the beer of the month for me.  it has replaced my other favorite Kilkenny.

sat good on the palate.

A great weisse.  One of my favorites.
Pale golden, hazy. Soft, dryish and light bodied.
not much difference from Schneider Weisse
Definitely a great beer, very tasty. Superb.

This one just about defines the style for me. Great fruity (apple) aftertaste. Very full flavored.
You have to be a fan of the Bavarian Weissen style to enjoy this superb brew.
The hefe-version is very drinkable, fresh, light, with a good acid aftertaste.
Wow!  This is truly a great brew.  The taste is truly unique and it is just bursting with flavor.

While I greatly enjoyed this brew, I must say I have some mixed emotions.  Taken by itself with no consideration of beer style, this is one good brew.  Very different from any other hefe or witbeir Ive experienced.  The yeast lends a defined sourness and lemon flavor in the aftertaste.  Malt and as yet unidentified fruit up front.  Yeast and malt in the nose.  A large, off white head on a deep copper, cloudy beer is quite beautiful.  Fairly soft on the palate, but very acceptable none-the-less. Absolutly NOT a typical white beer, as user_experience pointed out.  It is, however, quite good all around.

The commercial description might be misleading. This is not a typical white beer. Its hardly cloudy and not white but a deep copper. The aroma leans less from yeast and banana, which is but an aromatic hue, to more typical carmel and alcohols. There are also non-dominant apple fruit components. Very carbonated from the bottle with a gorgeous presentation, warming decreases the initial fizz and after five minutes or so becomes much more palatable with the yeast components waking up with delicate bitters as well. This is an interesting and unique brew that I wouldnt go out of the way for, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.
Nice banana aroma. Very full. Sweet, not yeasty.
a bit bolder than most wheat beers though not overpowering. spicy fruit flavour really lingers on the palate

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2004 bubblegum and fruit aroma - lovely creamy, bready texture - very tasty combination of plums, toffee, vanilla, delicate hallertau herbalness, banana - finishing slightly tart, slightly phenolic and salty. full, complex, tasty, refreshing - what more do you want in a hefeweizen? rer8: ok it's a bit too sweet, crystal malty, and heavy for a hefe
One of absolutely the best beer on this terrestrial beeer ball!
I like a beer thats bottle conditioned--flaschengarung.
I had this years ago, before I was actually into wheat beers.  I remember liking it. A good, rich wheat beer.

my first experience with a wheat style beer was spanish peaks black dog wheat ale. my second experience was maisels weisse. what a difference! this is one terrific brew. set the standard for me, anyway. love it.

A damn fine German wheat.  Description says unmistakable character of fine cellar yeast and Ill wholeheartedly agree.  The yeast adds so much character to this brew.  This was my favorite German beer for the longest time.

Excellent yeast aroma with a symphony of fruity esters. I craved this beer more with every sip. This beer is extremely pleasant on the palate. Ever so slightly sour in the finish, just the way I love it. What a great beer!

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2004 The beer separates from the 355ml brown bottle a beclouded amber with a generous white head that is spumous in texture and as it fades away, the lace forms a tight skirt to surround the glass. Nose has a nice hint of yeast, over ripe bananas and a it has a crisp freshness, start is sweet with a nice grain profile, top is light to medium in feel. Finish is pleasantly acidic, the hops personable in their spiciness, desert dry and long lasting aftertaste, a fine beer for a hot Arizona day.
